Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime import time # Create workspace directory os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print("Alternative search strategy for 2002 Sedin twins incident") print("Bypassing rate limits with focused, spaced searches") print("=" * 60) # Get SerpAPI key from environment variables api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("‚ùå Error: Missing API key. Make sure you have SERPAPI_API_KEY in your environment variables.") else: print("‚úÖ SerpAPI key found - proceeding with alternative search strategy") # Based on HISTORY analysis, we need to find: # 1. Public complaints about the incident # 2. Injury protocol changes by Vancouver Canucks # 3. Specific incident details beyond Henrik's overtime goal # Try a more general approach with longer delays alternative_queries = [ # Start with broader terms that might have less competition '"Henrik Sedin" "Daniel Sedin" 2002 playoffs controversy Vancouver', 'Vancouver Canucks injury controversy 2002 complaint protocol', '"Sedin twins" 2002 incident complaint medical staff Vancouver' ] print(f"\nüéØ Executing {len(alternative_queries)} alternative searches with extended delays:") print("-" * 65) all_results = [] successful_searches = 0 for i, query in enumerate(alternative_queries, 1): print(f"\nQuery {i}/{len(alternative_queries)}: {query}") try: # Extended delay to avoid rate limiting if i > 1: print("‚è≥ Waiting 15 seconds to avoid rate limits...") time.sleep(15) # Prepare API request with reduced result count params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 5, # Reduced to minimize API load "type": "search" } # Make API request response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: search_data = response.json() if search_data.get("organic_results"): results = search_data["organic_results"] print(f"‚úÖ Found {len(results)} results") # Add query context for result in results: result['query_text'] = query result['query_number'] = i all_results.extend(results) successful_searches += 1 # Analyze results immediately for key information print(f"\nüìã IMMEDIATE ANALYSIS:") for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') snippet = result.get('snippet', '') link = result.get('link', '') print(f"\nResult {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:200]}..." if len(snippet) > 200 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") print(f"Link: {link}") # Check for key terms we're missing combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" key_findings = [] # Check for complaints/criticism if any(term in combined_text for term in ['complaint', 'complain', 'criticiz', 'criticism']): key_findings.append('üó£Ô∏è COMPLAINT/CRITICISM FOUND') # Check for protocol/policy changes if any(term in combined_text for term in ['protocol', 'policy', 'procedure', 'change']): key_findings.append('üìã PROTOCOL/POLICY MENTIONED') # Check for incident details if any(term in combined_text for term in ['incident', 'controversy', 'medical staff']): key_findings.append('üö® INCIDENT DETAILS') # Check for Sedin twins if 'sedin' in combined_text: key_findings.append('üèí SEDIN REFERENCE') # Check for 2002 playoffs if '2002' in combined_text and 'playoff' in combined_text: key_findings.append('üìÖ 2002 PLAYOFFS') if key_findings: print(f"üéØ KEY FINDINGS: {' | '.join(key_findings)}") # Highlight breakthrough results if len(key_findings) >= 3: print(f"üî• HIGH-VALUE RESULT: Multiple key elements found!") else: print(f"‚ÑπÔ∏è No key terms detected") print("-" * 50) else: print(f"‚ùå No organic results found") all_results.append({ 'title': 'No results', 'snippet': 'No organic results returned', 'query_text': query, 'query_number': i }) elif response.status_code == 429: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Rate limited - extending delay further") print(f"‚è≥ Waiting 30 seconds before continuing...") time.sleep(30) all_results.append({ 'title': 'Rate Limited', 'snippet': 'API rate limit reached despite extended delays', 'query_text': query, 'query_number': i }) else: print(f"‚ùå API request failed with status {response.status_code}") print(f"Response: {response.text[:200]}...") all_results.append({ 'title': 'API Error', 'snippet': f'API request failed: {response.status_code}', 'query_text': query, 'query_number': i }) except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error during search: {e}") all_results.append({ 'title': 'Search Error', 'snippet': f'Search failed: {str(e)}', 'query_text': query, 'query_number': i }) print(f"\n" + "=" * 70) print("COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS ANALYSIS") print("=" * 70) print(f"\nüìä SEARCH SUMMARY:") print(f"Total queries attempted: {len(alternative_queries)}") print(f"Successful searches: {successful_searches}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}") # Filter valid results valid_results = [r for r in all_results if r.get('title') not in ['No results', 'API Error', 'Rate Limited', 'Search Error']] print(f"Valid results for analysis: {len(valid_results)}") if len(valid_results) > 0: print(f"\nüîç DETAILED ANALYSIS OF ALL VALID RESULTS:") print("-" * 45) # Comprehensive analysis of all results plan_progress = { 'complaint_references': [], 'protocol_references': [], 'incident_details': [], 'sedin_references': [], 'high_value_results': [] } for i, result in enumerate(valid_results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') snippet = result.get('snippet', '') link = result.get('link', '') query = result.get('query_text', '') combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" print(f"\nüìÑ RESULT {i}:") print(f"Query: {query}") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet}") print(f"Link: {link}") # Detailed analysis analysis_score = 0 analysis_notes = [] # Check for complaints (highest priority - missing from PLAN) if any(term in combined_text for term in ['complaint', 'complain', 'criticiz', 'criticism', 'blamed']): analysis_score += 10 analysis_notes.append('COMPLAINT/CRITICISM DETECTED') plan_progress['complaint_references'].append({ 'result_number': i, 'title': title, 'snippet': snippet, 'link': link }) # Check for protocol changes (highest priority - missing from PLAN) if any(term in combined_text for term in ['protocol', 'policy', 'procedure', 'revision', 'change']): analysis_score += 10 analysis_notes.append('PROTOCOL/POLICY CHANGE DETECTED') plan_progress['protocol_references'].append({ 'result_number': i, 'title': title, 'snippet': snippet, 'link': link }) # Check for incident details if any(term in combined_text for term in ['incident', 'controversy', 'medical staff', 'team doctor']): analysis_score += 5 analysis_notes.append('INCIDENT DETAILS') plan_progress['incident_details'].append({ 'result_number': i, 'title': title, 'snippet': snippet, 'link': link }) # Check for Sedin references if 'sedin' in combined_text: analysis_score += 3 analysis_notes.append('SEDIN MENTIONED') plan_progress['sedin_references'].append({ 'result_number': i, 'title': title, 'snippet': snippet, 'link': link }) # Check for 2002 playoffs context if '2002' in combined_text and 'playoff' in combined_text: analysis_score += 2 analysis_notes.append('2002 PLAYOFFS CONTEXT') print(f"Analysis Score: {analysis_score}") if analysis_notes: print(f"Key Elements: {' | '.join(analysis_notes)}") if analysis_score >= 15: print(f"üî• BREAKTHROUGH RESULT - Contains multiple missing PLAN elements!") plan_progress['high_value_results'].append(result) elif analysis_score >= 10: print(f"‚≠ê HIGH-VALUE RESULT - Contains core missing information") plan_progress['high_value_results'].append(result) elif analysis_score >= 5: print(f"üìã RELEVANT RESULT - Contains some useful information") else: print(f"‚ÑπÔ∏è Limited relevance to PLAN objectives") print("-" * 60) # Save comprehensive results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') results_file = f'workspace/sedin_twins_alternative_search_{timestamp}.json' comprehensive_results = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Alternative search strategy with extended delays', 'plan_objective': 'Find 2002 Sedin twins incident: complaints and protocol changes', 'queries_attempted': len(alternative_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_results': len(all_results), 'valid_results': len(valid_results), 'queries_used': alternative_queries, 'all_search_results': all_results, 'plan_progress_analysis': plan_progress, 'high_value_results_count': len(plan_progress['high_value_results']), 'complaint_references_found': len(plan_progress['complaint_references']), 'protocol_references_found': len(plan_progress['protocol_references']) } with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(comprehensive_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Comprehensive results saved to: {results_file}") # Create final assessment assessment_file = f'workspace/sedin_twins_plan_assessment_{timestamp}.txt' with open(assessment_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("SEDIN TWINS 2002 INCIDENT - ALTERNATIVE SEARCH ASSESSMENT\n") f.write("=" * 55 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Search Date: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Search Method: Alternative strategy with extended delays\n") f.write(f"Successful Searches: {successful_searches}/{len(alternative_queries)}\n") f.write(f"Valid Results: {len(valid_results)}\n\n") f.write("PLAN PROGRESS:\n") f.write("-" * 15 + "\n") f.write(f"Complaint references found: {len(plan_progress['complaint_references'])}\n") f.write(f"Protocol references found: {len(plan_progress['protocol_references'])}\n") f.write(f"Incident details found: {len(plan_progress['incident_details'])}\n") f.write(f"High-value results: {len(plan_progress['high_value_results'])}\n\n") # Calculate completion status objectives_met = 0 if len(plan_progress['complaint_references']) > 0: objectives_met += 1 f.write("‚úÖ Public complaints: FOUND\n") else: f.write("‚ùå Public complaints: NOT FOUND\n") if len(plan_progress['protocol_references']) > 0: objectives_met += 1 f.write("‚úÖ Protocol changes: FOUND\n") else: f.write("‚ùå Protocol changes: NOT FOUND\n") # We already know Henrik's goal is confirmed from previous analysis f.write("‚úÖ Henrik overtime goal: CONFIRMED (from previous analysis)\n") objectives_met += 1 if len(plan_progress['incident_details']) > 0: objectives_met += 1 f.write("‚úÖ Incident details: FOUND\n") else: f.write("‚ùå Incident details: NOT FOUND\n") completion_percentage = (objectives_met / 4) * 100 f.write(f"\nCOMPLETION: {objectives_met}/4 objectives ({completion_percentage:.1f}%)\n") if completion_percentage >= 75: f.write("\nSTATUS: PLAN NEARLY COMPLETED\n") f.write("Recommendation: Analyze high-value results for final details\n") elif completion_percentage >= 50: f.write("\nSTATUS: SIGNIFICANT PROGRESS\n") f.write("Recommendation: Continue targeted searches for missing elements\n") else: f.write("\nSTATUS: LIMITED PROGRESS\n") f.write("Recommendation: Consider alternative sources or broader search terms\n") print(f"üìÑ Assessment saved to: {assessment_file}") # Final summary print(f"\nüèÅ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH COMPLETED") print(f"\nüìã FINAL SUMMARY:") print(f"‚Ä¢ Queries executed: {len(alternative_queries)}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Successful searches: {successful_searches}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Valid results: {len(valid_results)}") print(f"‚Ä¢ High-value results: {len(plan_progress['high_value_results'])}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Complaint references: {len(plan_progress['complaint_references'])}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Protocol references: {len(plan_progress['protocol_references'])}") if len(plan_progress['high_value_results']) > 0: print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found {len(plan_progress['high_value_results'])} high-value results!") print(f"üéØ These results contain the missing PLAN elements we've been seeking") elif len(valid_results) > 0: print(f"\nüìã PARTIAL SUCCESS: Found some relevant information") print(f"üîç May need additional searches or alternative approaches") else: print(f"\n‚ùå LIMITED SUCCESS: No breakthrough results found") print(f"üìù Consider searching hockey journalism archives or Vancouver media") else: print(f"\n‚ùå No valid results obtained") print(f"üîç All searches failed due to rate limiting or other issues") print(f"üìù May need to wait longer between searches or try different approach") # Save failure log timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') failure_log = f'workspace/search_failure_log_{timestamp}.txt' with open(failure_log, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("SEARCH FAILURE LOG\n") f.write("=" * 20 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Date: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Attempted queries: {len(alternative_queries)}\n") f.write(f"Successful searches: {successful_searches}\n") f.write(f"Failure reason: API rate limiting or other errors\n\n") f.write("All results:\n") for i, result in enumerate(all_results, 1): f.write(f"{i}. {result.get('title', 'No title')} - {result.get('snippet', 'No snippet')}\n") print(f"üìÑ Failure log saved to: {failure_log}") print(f"\nüéØ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGY COMPLETE")
Execution Output

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code encountered severe API rate limiting (HTTP 429) across all search queries, preventing any successful data retrieval. The output shows consistent '‚ö†Ô∏è Rate limited - waiting longer' messages with 0 successful searches out of 8 attempts, resulting in no valid results to analyze. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no progress made toward finding the missing elements (public complaints about the 2002 Sedin twins incident and subsequent Canucks injury protocol changes) due to complete API failure. While the search queries were well-designed and highly targeted ('Vancouver Canucks injury handling controversy 2002 playoffs media criticism', 'Henrik Daniel Sedin injury management complaint 2002 Stanley Cup playoffs'), the SerpAPI service appears to have strict rate limits that completely blocked execution. Based on HISTORY analysis, this represents the latest in a series of API rate limiting failures, and previous workspace analysis confirmed that existing scraped data only contains basic Hockey Reference statistics (Henrik's overtime goal on April 17, 2002) but lacks the controversy details the PLAN seeks. Since API-based searches are consistently failing and existing data has been thoroughly analyzed as insufficient, recommend: (1) Save the rate limiting failure log to 'workspace/search_rate_limit_failure_log.txt' for documentation, (2) Consider that this specific incident may be poorly documented online or may not have occurred as described in the PLAN, (3) Alternative approach: try searching broader terms like 'Vancouver Canucks medical staff controversy early 2000s' or 'NHL injury protocol changes 2002-2003' to see if related incidents can be found, or (4) Acknowledge that the specific incident described in the PLAN may not be well-documented in publicly available sources.
Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime import time # Create workspace directory os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print("Alternative search strategy for 2002 Sedin twins incident") print("Bypassing rate limits with focused, spaced searches") print("=" * 60) # Get SerpAPI key from environment variables api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("‚ùå Error: Missing API key. Make sure you have SERPAPI_API_KEY in your environment variables.") else: print("‚úÖ SerpAPI key found - proceeding with alternative search strategy") # Based on HISTORY analysis, we need to find: # 1. Public complaints about the incident # 2. Injury protocol changes by Vancouver Canucks # 3. Specific incident details beyond Henrik's overtime goal # Try a more general approach with longer delays alternative_queries = [ # Start with broader terms that might have less competition '"Henrik Sedin" "Daniel Sedin" 2002 playoffs controversy Vancouver', 'Vancouver Canucks injury controversy 2002 complaint protocol', '"Sedin twins" 2002 incident complaint medical staff Vancouver' ] print(f"\nüéØ Executing {len(alternative_queries)} alternative searches with extended delays:") print("-" * 65) all_results = [] successful_searches = 0 for i, query in enumerate(alternative_queries, 1): print(f"\nQuery {i}/{len(alternative_queries)}: {query}") try: # Extended delay to avoid rate limiting if i > 1: print("‚è≥ Waiting 15 seconds to avoid rate limits...") time.sleep(15) # Prepare API request with reduced result count params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 5, # Reduced to minimize API load "type": "search" } # Make API request response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: search_data = response.json() if search_data.get("organic_results"): results = search_data["organic_results"] print(f"‚úÖ Found {len(results)} results") # Add query context for result in results: result['query_text'] = query result['query_number'] = i all_results.extend(results) successful_searches += 1 # Analyze results immediately for key information print(f"\nüìã IMMEDIATE ANALYSIS:") for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') snippet = result.get('snippet', '') link = result.get('link', '') print(f"\nResult {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:200]}..." if len(snippet) > 200 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") print(f"Link: {link}") # Check for key terms we're missing combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" key_findings = [] # Check for complaints/criticism if any(term in combined_text for term in ['complaint', 'complain', 'criticiz', 'criticism']): key_findings.append('üó£Ô∏è COMPLAINT/CRITICISM FOUND') # Check for protocol/policy changes if any(term in combined_text for term in ['protocol', 'policy', 'procedure', 'change']): key_findings.append('üìã PROTOCOL/POLICY MENTIONED') # Check for incident details if any(term in combined_text for term in ['incident', 'controversy', 'medical staff']): key_findings.append('üö® INCIDENT DETAILS') # Check for Sedin twins if 'sedin' in combined_text: key_findings.append('üèí SEDIN REFERENCE') # Check for 2002 playoffs if '2002' in combined_text and 'playoff' in combined_text: key_findings.append('üìÖ 2002 PLAYOFFS') if key_findings: print(f"üéØ KEY FINDINGS: {' | '.join(key_findings)}") # Highlight breakthrough results if len(key_findings) >= 3: print(f"üî• HIGH-VALUE RESULT: Multiple key elements found!") else: print(f"‚ÑπÔ∏è No key terms detected") print("-" * 50) else: print(f"‚ùå No organic results found") all_results.append({ 'title': 'No results', 'snippet': 'No organic results returned', 'query_text': query, 'query_number': i }) elif response.status_code == 429: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Rate limited - extending delay further") print(f"‚è≥ Waiting 30 seconds before continuing...") time.sleep(30) all_results.append({ 'title': 'Rate Limited', 'snippet': 'API rate limit reached despite extended delays', 'query_text': query, 'query_number': i }) else: print(f"‚ùå API request failed with status {response.status_code}") print(f"Response: {response.text[:200]}...") all_results.append({ 'title': 'API Error', 'snippet': f'API request failed: {response.status_code}', 'query_text': query, 'query_number': i }) except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error during search: {e}") all_results.append({ 'title': 'Search Error', 'snippet': f'Search failed: {str(e)}', 'query_text': query, 'query_number': i }) print(f"\n" + "=" * 70) print("COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS ANALYSIS") print("=" * 70) print(f"\nüìä SEARCH SUMMARY:") print(f"Total queries attempted: {len(alternative_queries)}") print(f"Successful searches: {successful_searches}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}") # Filter valid results valid_results = [r for r in all_results if r.get('title') not in ['No results', 'API Error', 'Rate Limited', 'Search Error']] print(f"Valid results for analysis: {len(valid_results)}") if len(valid_results) > 0: print(f"\nüîç DETAILED ANALYSIS OF ALL VALID RESULTS:") print("-" * 45) # Comprehensive analysis of all results plan_progress = { 'complaint_references': [], 'protocol_references': [], 'incident_details': [], 'sedin_references': [], 'high_value_results': [] } for i, result in enumerate(valid_results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') snippet = result.get('snippet', '') link = result.get('link', '') query = result.get('query_text', '') combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" print(f"\nüìÑ RESULT {i}:") print(f"Query: {query}") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet}") print(f"Link: {link}") # Detailed analysis analysis_score = 0 analysis_notes = [] # Check for complaints (highest priority - missing from PLAN) if any(term in combined_text for term in ['complaint', 'complain', 'criticiz', 'criticism', 'blamed']): analysis_score += 10 analysis_notes.append('COMPLAINT/CRITICISM DETECTED') plan_progress['complaint_references'].append({ 'result_number': i, 'title': title, 'snippet': snippet, 'link': link }) # Check for protocol changes (highest priority - missing from PLAN) if any(term in combined_text for term in ['protocol', 'policy', 'procedure', 'revision', 'change']): analysis_score += 10 analysis_notes.append('PROTOCOL/POLICY CHANGE DETECTED') plan_progress['protocol_references'].append({ 'result_number': i, 'title': title, 'snippet': snippet, 'link': link }) # Check for incident details if any(term in combined_text for term in ['incident', 'controversy', 'medical staff', 'team doctor']): analysis_score += 5 analysis_notes.append('INCIDENT DETAILS') plan_progress['incident_details'].append({ 'result_number': i, 'title': title, 'snippet': snippet, 'link': link }) # Check for Sedin references if 'sedin' in combined_text: analysis_score += 3 analysis_notes.append('SEDIN MENTIONED') plan_progress['sedin_references'].append({ 'result_number': i, 'title': title, 'snippet': snippet, 'link': link }) # Check for 2002 playoffs context if '2002' in combined_text and 'playoff' in combined_text: analysis_score += 2 analysis_notes.append('2002 PLAYOFFS CONTEXT') print(f"Analysis Score: {analysis_score}") if analysis_notes: print(f"Key Elements: {' | '.join(analysis_notes)}") if analysis_score >= 15: print(f"üî• BREAKTHROUGH RESULT - Contains multiple missing PLAN elements!") plan_progress['high_value_results'].append(result) elif analysis_score >= 10: print(f"‚≠ê HIGH-VALUE RESULT - Contains core missing information") plan_progress['high_value_results'].append(result) elif analysis_score >= 5: print(f"üìã RELEVANT RESULT - Contains some useful information") else: print(f"‚ÑπÔ∏è Limited relevance to PLAN objectives") print("-" * 60) # Save comprehensive results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') results_file = f'workspace/sedin_twins_alternative_search_{timestamp}.json' comprehensive_results = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Alternative search strategy with extended delays', 'plan_objective': 'Find 2002 Sedin twins incident: complaints and protocol changes', 'queries_attempted': len(alternative_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_results': len(all_results), 'valid_results': len(valid_results), 'queries_used': alternative_queries, 'all_search_results': all_results, 'plan_progress_analysis': plan_progress, 'high_value_results_count': len(plan_progress['high_value_results']), 'complaint_references_found': len(plan_progress['complaint_references']), 'protocol_references_found': len(plan_progress['protocol_references']) } with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(comprehensive_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Comprehensive results saved to: {results_file}") # Create final assessment assessment_file = f'workspace/sedin_twins_plan_assessment_{timestamp}.txt' with open(assessment_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("SEDIN TWINS 2002 INCIDENT - ALTERNATIVE SEARCH ASSESSMENT\n") f.write("=" * 55 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Search Date: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Search Method: Alternative strategy with extended delays\n") f.write(f"Successful Searches: {successful_searches}/{len(alternative_queries)}\n") f.write(f"Valid Results: {len(valid_results)}\n\n") f.write("PLAN PROGRESS:\n") f.write("-" * 15 + "\n") f.write(f"Complaint references found: {len(plan_progress['complaint_references'])}\n") f.write(f"Protocol references found: {len(plan_progress['protocol_references'])}\n") f.write(f"Incident details found: {len(plan_progress['incident_details'])}\n") f.write(f"High-value results: {len(plan_progress['high_value_results'])}\n\n") # Calculate completion status objectives_met = 0 if len(plan_progress['complaint_references']) > 0: objectives_met += 1 f.write("‚úÖ Public complaints: FOUND\n") else: f.write("‚ùå Public complaints: NOT FOUND\n") if len(plan_progress['protocol_references']) > 0: objectives_met += 1 f.write("‚úÖ Protocol changes: FOUND\n") else: f.write("‚ùå Protocol changes: NOT FOUND\n") # We already know Henrik's goal is confirmed from previous analysis f.write("‚úÖ Henrik overtime goal: CONFIRMED (from previous analysis)\n") objectives_met += 1 if len(plan_progress['incident_details']) > 0: objectives_met += 1 f.write("‚úÖ Incident details: FOUND\n") else: f.write("‚ùå Incident details: NOT FOUND\n") completion_percentage = (objectives_met / 4) * 100 f.write(f"\nCOMPLETION: {objectives_met}/4 objectives ({completion_percentage:.1f}%)\n") if completion_percentage >= 75: f.write("\nSTATUS: PLAN NEARLY COMPLETED\n") f.write("Recommendation: Analyze high-value results for final details\n") elif completion_percentage >= 50: f.write("\nSTATUS: SIGNIFICANT PROGRESS\n") f.write("Recommendation: Continue targeted searches for missing elements\n") else: f.write("\nSTATUS: LIMITED PROGRESS\n") f.write("Recommendation: Consider alternative sources or broader search terms\n") print(f"üìÑ Assessment saved to: {assessment_file}") # Final summary print(f"\nüèÅ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH COMPLETED") print(f"\nüìã FINAL SUMMARY:") print(f"‚Ä¢ Queries executed: {len(alternative_queries)}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Successful searches: {successful_searches}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Valid results: {len(valid_results)}") print(f"‚Ä¢ High-value results: {len(plan_progress['high_value_results'])}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Complaint references: {len(plan_progress['complaint_references'])}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Protocol references: {len(plan_progress['protocol_references'])}") if len(plan_progress['high_value_results']) > 0: print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found {len(plan_progress['high_value_results'])} high-value results!") print(f"üéØ These results contain the missing PLAN elements we've been seeking") elif len(valid_results) > 0: print(f"\nüìã PARTIAL SUCCESS: Found some relevant information") print(f"üîç May need additional searches or alternative approaches") else: print(f"\n‚ùå LIMITED SUCCESS: No breakthrough results found") print(f"üìù Consider searching hockey journalism archives or Vancouver media") else: print(f"\n‚ùå No valid results obtained") print(f"üîç All searches failed due to rate limiting or other issues") print(f"üìù May need to wait longer between searches or try different approach") # Save failure log timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') failure_log = f'workspace/search_failure_log_{timestamp}.txt' with open(failure_log, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("SEARCH FAILURE LOG\n") f.write("=" * 20 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Date: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Attempted queries: {len(alternative_queries)}\n") f.write(f"Successful searches: {successful_searches}\n") f.write(f"Failure reason: API rate limiting or other errors\n\n") f.write("All results:\n") for i, result in enumerate(all_results, 1): f.write(f"{i}. {result.get('title', 'No title')} - {result.get('snippet', 'No snippet')}\n") print(f"üìÑ Failure log saved to: {failure_log}") print(f"\nüéØ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGY COMPLETE")

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # Create workspace directory os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print("FINAL ASSESSMENT: 2002 Sedin Twins Incident Search") print("Comprehensive analysis of search attempts and data limitations") print("=" * 65) # First, let's document what we know from previous analysis print("\nüìã REVIEWING PREVIOUS FINDINGS FROM HISTORY:") print("-" * 45) confirmed_facts = { 'henrik_overtime_goal': { 'confirmed': True, 'details': { 'date': 'April 17, 2002', 'game': 'Vancouver 4-3 Detroit', 'time': '13:59 of overtime', 'competition': '2002 Stanley Cup Playoffs', 'source': 'Hockey Reference - confirmed in previous analysis' } }, 'public_complaints': { 'confirmed': False, 'search_attempts': 'Multiple targeted searches failed due to API rate limiting', 'data_sources_checked': 'Hockey Reference, comprehensive scraped data' }, 'injury_protocol_changes': { 'confirmed': False, 'search_attempts': 'Multiple targeted searches failed due to API rate limiting', 'data_sources_checked': 'Hockey Reference, organizational data not found' }, 'specific_incident_details': { 'confirmed': False, 'search_attempts': 'Comprehensive analysis of 10+ scraped sections found no controversy details', 'data_sources_checked': 'Hockey Reference statistical pages, playoff records' } } print("\n‚úÖ CONFIRMED INFORMATION:") print(f"‚Ä¢ Henrik Sedin scored overtime goal on {confirmed_facts['henrik_overtime_goal']['details']['date']}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Game: {confirmed_facts['henrik_overtime_goal']['details']['game']}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Time: {confirmed_facts['henrik_overtime_goal']['details']['time']}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Competition: {confirmed_facts['henrik_overtime_goal']['details']['competition']}") print("\n‚ùå MISSING INFORMATION (Unable to locate):") print("‚Ä¢ Public complaints about the incident") print("‚Ä¢ Vancouver Canucks injury protocol changes") print("‚Ä¢ Specific incident details beyond the overtime goal") # Check if we have any existing analysis files to reference print("\nüîç CHECKING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA:") print("-" * 40) if os.path.exists('workspace'): files = os.listdir('workspace') sedin_files = [f for f in files if 'sedin' in f.lower()] print(f"Found {len(sedin_files)} Sedin-related files in workspace") # Look for the most recent comprehensive analysis analysis_files = [f for f in sedin_files if 'analysis' in f.lower() or 'assessment' in f.lower()] if analysis_files: # Get the most recent analysis file latest_analysis = sorted(analysis_files)[-1] analysis_path = f'workspace/{latest_analysis}' print(f"\nüìÑ Examining latest analysis: {latest_analysis}") try: # First, inspect the file structure with open(analysis_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() print(f"File size: {len(content):,} characters") # Check if it's JSON or text if latest_analysis.endswith('.json'): try: data = json.loads(content) print(f"JSON structure - Root keys: {list(data.keys())[:5]}") # Look for completion status or findings if 'completion_percentage' in data: completion = data['completion_percentage'] print(f"Previous completion percentage: {completion}%") if 'objectives_status' in data: status = data['objectives_status'] print(f"Objectives status: {status}") if 'plan_status' in data: plan_status = data['plan_status'] print(f"Plan status: {plan_status}") except json.JSONDecodeError: print("File appears to be JSON but has formatting issues") else: # Text file - show first few lines lines = content.split('\n')[:10] print("Text file preview:") for i, line in enumerate(lines, 1): if line.strip(): print(f" {i}: {line[:80]}..." if len(line) > 80 else f" {i}: {line}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error reading analysis file: {e}") # Document the search failure pattern print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è DOCUMENTED SEARCH FAILURES:") print("‚Ä¢ Multiple SerpAPI rate limiting (HTTP 429) errors") print("‚Ä¢ 0 successful searches out of 8+ attempts") print("‚Ä¢ Extended delays (15-30 seconds) did not resolve rate limiting") print("‚Ä¢ Alternative query strategies also failed") else: print("No workspace directory found") # Create comprehensive final assessment print("\n" + "=" * 70) print("FINAL PLAN ASSESSMENT AND RECOMMENDATIONS") print("=" * 70) # Calculate what we've achieved vs what was requested plan_objectives = [ { 'objective': 'Find details about Henrik and Daniel Sedin incident during 2002 playoffs', 'status': 'PARTIAL', 'details': 'Found Henrik\'s overtime goal on April 17, 2002, but no incident details' }, { 'objective': 'Identify who made public complaints about the incident', 'status': 'NOT_FOUND', 'details': 'No complaints found in available data sources' }, { 'objective': 'Find how this led to Vancouver Canucks revising injury protocols', 'status': 'NOT_FOUND', 'details': 'No protocol changes documented in available sources' }, { 'objective': 'Gather specific incident details beyond basic game statistics', 'status': 'NOT_FOUND', 'details': 'Only statistical data found, no controversy or incident details' } ] objectives_completed = sum(1 for obj in plan_objectives if obj['status'] in ['COMPLETED', 'PARTIAL']) total_objectives = len(plan_objectives) completion_percentage = (objectives_completed / total_objectives) * 100 print(f"\nüìä PLAN COMPLETION ANALYSIS:") print(f"Objectives completed/partial: {objectives_completed}/{total_objectives} ({completion_percentage:.1f}%)") for i, obj in enumerate(plan_objectives, 1): status_icon = "‚úÖ" if obj['status'] == 'COMPLETED' else "üîÑ" if obj['status'] == 'PARTIAL' else "‚ùå" print(f"\n{i}. {obj['objective']}") print(f" {status_icon} Status: {obj['status']}") print(f" Details: {obj['details']}") # Assessment of data availability print(f"\nüîç DATA SOURCE ASSESSMENT:") print("-" * 30) print("‚úÖ Hockey Reference: Comprehensive statistical data available") print("‚úÖ Basic playoff records: Game results and player statistics confirmed") print("‚ùå Media coverage: Limited access due to API restrictions") print("‚ùå Organizational records: No access to internal Canucks documentation") print("‚ùå Sports journalism archives: Not accessible through current search methods") # Possible explanations print(f"\nüí≠ POSSIBLE EXPLANATIONS:") print("-" * 25) print("1. The specific incident described in the PLAN may not have occurred") print("2. The incident may be poorly documented in publicly available sources") print("3. The incident may have been internal/private with limited media coverage") print("4. The search terms may not match how the incident was reported") print("5. The incident details may be in sources not accessible via web search") # Create final documentation timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') final_report_file = f'workspace/sedin_twins_2002_final_report_{timestamp}.json' final_report = { 'report_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'plan_objective': 'Find information about 2002 Sedin twins playoff incident leading to complaints and protocol changes', 'search_duration': 'Multiple attempts over extended period', 'completion_status': { 'overall_completion': f'{completion_percentage:.1f}%', 'objectives_completed': objectives_completed, 'total_objectives': total_objectives, 'status': 'PARTIALLY_COMPLETED' if completion_percentage > 0 else 'INSUFFICIENT_DATA' }, 'confirmed_findings': { 'henrik_sedin_overtime_goal': { 'date': '2002-04-17', 'opponent': 'Detroit Red Wings', 'result': 'Vancouver 4-3 Detroit', 'time': '13:59 of overtime', 'source': 'Hockey Reference' } }, 'missing_information': [ 'Public complaints about the incident', 'Identity of who made complaints', 'Specific incident details beyond overtime goal', 'Vancouver Canucks injury protocol changes', access to internal organizational documents', 'Existing scraped data limited to statistical sources' ], 'data_sources_examined': [ 'Hockey Reference (comprehensive)', 'Multiple comprehensive search attempts', '10+ relevant sections analyzed', 'Multiple targeted search queries attempted' ], 'recommendations': [ 'The specific incident as described may not be well-documented online', 'Alternative sources like Vancouver media archives may be needed', 'Internal Canucks organizational records would be required for protocol details', 'Consider that the incident may not have occurred as described in the PLAN' ] } with open(final_report_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Final report saved to: {final_report_file}") # Create complaints\n") f.write("and caused Vancouver Canucks to revise their injury protocols.\n\n") f.write("CONFIRMED FINDINGS:\n") f.write("-" * 18 + "\n") f.write("‚úÖ Henrik Sedin scored overtime goal on April 17, 2002\n") f.write(" ‚Ä¢ Game: Vancouver 4-3 Detroit\n") f.write(" ‚Ä¢ Time: 13:59 of overtime\n") f.write(" ‚Ä¢ Competition: 2002 Stanley Cup Playoffs\n") f.write(" ‚Ä¢ Source: Hockey Reference (confirmed)\n\n") f.write("MISSING INFORMATION:\n") f.write("-" * 20 + "\n") f.write("‚ùå Public complaints about the incident\n") f.write("‚ùå Identity of who made complaints\n") f.write("‚ùå Vancouver Canucks injury protocol changes\n") f.write("‚ùå Specific incident details beyond the overtime goal\n\n") f.write("SEARCH CHALLENGES:\n") f.write("-" * 18 + "\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ Persistent API rate limiting prevented comprehensive searches\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ Existing data sources limited to statistical information\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ No access to sports journalism archives or organizational records\n\n") f.write("CONCLUSION:\n") f.write("-" * 11 + "\n") f.write("While we confirmed Henrik Sedin's notable overtime goal performance\n") f.write("during the 2002 playoffs, the specific incident involving complaints\n") f.write("and protocol changes described in the PLAN could not be located\n") f.write("in available public sources. This may indicate the incident is\n") f.write("poorly documented online or may not have occurred as described.\n") print(f"üìÑ Summary saved to: {summary_file}") print(f"\nüèÅ FINAL ASSESSMENT COMPLETED") print(f"\nüìã CONCLUSION:") print(f"We have confirmed Henrik Sedin's overtime goal on April 17, 2002,") print(f"but were unable to locate the specific incident involving complaints") print(f"and injury protocol changes described in the PLAN. This suggests") print(f"either the incident is poorly documented in public sources or may") print(f"not have occurred as described.") print(f"\n‚úÖ DOCUMENTATION COMPLETE - All findings and limitations recorded")

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # Create workspace directory os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print("FINAL ASSESSMENT: 2002 Sedin Twins Incident Search") print("Comprehensive analysis of search attempts and data limitations") print("=" * 65) # First, let's document what we know from previous analysis print("\nüìã REVIEWING PREVIOUS FINDINGS FROM HISTORY:") print("-" * 45) confirmed_facts = { 'henrik_overtime_goal': { 'confirmed': True, 'details': { 'date': 'April 17, 2002', 'game': 'Vancouver 4-3 Detroit', 'time': '13:59 of overtime', 'competition': '2002 Stanley Cup Playoffs', 'source': 'Hockey Reference - confirmed in previous analysis' } }, 'public_complaints': { 'confirmed': False, 'search_attempts': 'Multiple targeted searches failed due to API rate limiting', 'data_sources_checked': 'Hockey Reference, comprehensive scraped data' }, 'injury_protocol_changes': { 'confirmed': False, 'search_attempts': 'Multiple targeted searches failed due to API rate limiting', 'data_sources_checked': 'Hockey Reference, organizational data not found' }, 'specific_incident_details': { 'confirmed': False, 'search_attempts': 'Comprehensive analysis of 10+ scraped sections found no controversy details', 'data_sources_checked': 'Hockey Reference statistical pages, playoff records' } } print("\n‚úÖ CONFIRMED INFORMATION:") print(f"‚Ä¢ Henrik Sedin scored overtime goal on {confirmed_facts['henrik_overtime_goal']['details']['date']}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Game: {confirmed_facts['henrik_overtime_goal']['details']['game']}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Time: {confirmed_facts['henrik_overtime_goal']['details']['time']}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Competition: {confirmed_facts['henrik_overtime_goal']['details']['competition']}") print("\n‚ùå MISSING INFORMATION (Unable to locate):") print("‚Ä¢ Public complaints about the incident") print("‚Ä¢ Vancouver Canucks injury protocol changes") print("‚Ä¢ Specific incident details beyond the overtime goal") # Check if we have any existing analysis files to reference print("\nüîç CHECKING EXISTING WORKSPACE DATA:") print("-" * 40) if os.path.exists('workspace'): files = os.listdir('workspace') sedin_files = [f for f in files if 'sedin' in f.lower()] print(f"Found {len(sedin_files)} Sedin-related files in workspace") # Look for the most recent comprehensive analysis analysis_files = [f for f in sedin_files if 'analysis' in f.lower() or 'assessment' in f.lower()] if analysis_files: # Get the most recent analysis file latest_analysis = sorted(analysis_files)[-1] analysis_path = f'workspace/{latest_analysis}' print(f"\nüìÑ Examining latest analysis: {latest_analysis}") try: # First, inspect the file structure with open(analysis_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() print(f"File size: {len(content):,} characters") # Check if it's JSON or text if latest_analysis.endswith('.json'): try: data = json.loads(content) print(f"JSON structure - Root keys: {list(data.keys())[:5]}") # Look for completion status or findings if 'completion_percentage' in data: completion = data['completion_percentage'] print(f"Previous completion percentage: {completion}%") if 'objectives_status' in data: status = data['objectives_status'] print(f"Objectives status: {status}") if 'plan_status' in data: plan_status = data['plan_status'] print(f"Plan status: {plan_status}") except json.JSONDecodeError: print("File appears to be JSON but has formatting issues") else: # Text file - show first few lines lines = content.split('\n')[:10] print("Text file preview:") for i, line in enumerate(lines, 1): if line.strip(): print(f" {i}: {line[:80]}..." if len(line) > 80 else f" {i}: {line}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error reading analysis file: {e}") # Document the search failure pattern print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è DOCUMENTED SEARCH FAILURES:") print("‚Ä¢ Multiple SerpAPI rate limiting (HTTP 429) errors") print("‚Ä¢ 0 successful searches out of 8+ attempts") print("‚Ä¢ Extended delays (15-30 seconds) did not resolve rate limiting") print("‚Ä¢ Alternative query strategies also failed") else: print("No workspace directory found") # Create comprehensive final assessment print("\n" + "=" * 70) print("FINAL PLAN ASSESSMENT AND RECOMMENDATIONS") print("=" * 70) # Calculate what we've achieved vs what was requested plan_objectives = [ { 'objective': 'Find details about Henrik and Daniel Sedin incident during 2002 playoffs', 'status': 'PARTIAL', 'details': 'Found Henrik\'s overtime goal on April 17, 2002, but no incident details' }, { 'objective': 'Identify who made public complaints about the incident', 'status': 'NOT_FOUND', 'details': 'No complaints found in available data sources' }, { 'objective': 'Find how this led to Vancouver Canucks revising injury protocols', 'status': 'NOT_FOUND', 'details': 'No protocol changes documented in available sources' }, { 'objective': 'Gather specific incident details beyond basic game statistics', 'status': 'NOT_FOUND', 'details': 'Only statistical data found, no controversy or incident details' } ] objectives_completed = sum(1 for obj in plan_objectives if obj['status'] in ['COMPLETED', 'PARTIAL']) total_objectives = len(plan_objectives) completion_percentage = (objectives_completed / total_objectives) * 100 print(f"\nüìä PLAN COMPLETION ANALYSIS:") print(f"Objectives completed/partial: {objectives_completed}/{total_objectives} ({completion_percentage:.1f}%)") for i, obj in enumerate(plan_objectives, 1): status_icon = "‚úÖ" if obj['status'] == 'COMPLETED' else "üîÑ" if obj['status'] == 'PARTIAL' else "‚ùå" print(f"\n{i}. {obj['objective']}") print(f" {status_icon} Status: {obj['status']}") print(f" Details: {obj['details']}") # Assessment of data availability print(f"\nüîç DATA SOURCE ASSESSMENT:") print("-" * 30) print("‚úÖ Hockey Reference: Comprehensive statistical data available") print("‚úÖ Basic playoff records: Game results and player statistics confirmed") print("‚ùå Media coverage: Limited access due to API restrictions") print("‚ùå Organizational records: No access to internal Canucks documentation") print("‚ùå Sports journalism archives: Not accessible through current search methods") # Possible explanations print(f"\nüí≠ POSSIBLE EXPLANATIONS:") print("-" * 25) print("1. The specific incident described in the PLAN may not have occurred") print("2. The incident may be poorly documented in publicly available sources") print("3. The incident may have been internal/private with limited media coverage") print("4. The search terms may not match how the incident was reported") print("5. The incident details may be in sources not accessible via web search") # Create final documentation timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') final_report_file = f'workspace/sedin_twins_2002_final_report_{timestamp}.json' final_report = { 'report_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'plan_objective': 'Find information about 2002 Sedin twins playoff incident leading to complaints and protocol changes', 'search_duration': 'Multiple attempts over extended period', 'completion_status': { 'overall_completion': f'{completion_percentage:.1f}%', 'objectives_completed': objectives_completed, 'total_objectives': total_objectives, 'status': 'PARTIALLY_COMPLETED' if completion_percentage > 0 else 'INSUFFICIENT_DATA' }, 'confirmed_findings': { 'henrik_sedin_overtime_goal': { 'date': '2002-04-17', 'opponent': 'Detroit Red Wings', 'result': 'Vancouver 4-3 Detroit', 'time': '13:59 of overtime', 'source': 'Hockey Reference' } }, 'missing_information': [ 'Public complaints about the incident', 'Identity of who made complaints', 'Specific incident details beyond overtime goal', 'Vancouver Canucks injury protocol changes', 'Timeline of protocol revisions', 'Organizational response to complaints' ], 'search_challenges': [ 'Persistent SerpAPI rate limiting (HTTP 429)', 'Limited access to sports journalism archives', 'No access to internal organizational documents', 'Existing scraped data limited to statistical sources' ], 'data_sources_examined': [ 'Hockey Reference (comprehensive)', 'Multiple comprehensive search attempts', '10+ relevant sections analyzed', 'Multiple targeted search queries attempted' ], 'recommendations': [ 'The specific incident as described may not be well-documented online', 'Alternative sources like Vancouver media archives may be needed', 'Internal Canucks organizational records would be required for protocol details', 'Consider that the incident may not have occurred as described in the PLAN' ] } with open(final_report_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Final report saved to: {final_report_file}") # Create readable summary summary_file = f'workspace/sedin_twins_2002_final_summary_{timestamp}.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("SEDIN TWINS 2002 INCIDENT - FINAL SEARCH SUMMARY\n") f.write("=" * 50 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Report Date: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Plan Completion: {completion_percentage:.1f}%\n\n") f.write("PLAN OBJECTIVE:\n") f.write("-" * 15 + "\n") f.write("Find information about an incident involving Henrik and Daniel Sedin\n") f.write("during the 2002 Stanley Cup playoffs that led to public complaints\n") f.write("and caused Vancouver Canucks to revise their injury protocols.\n\n") f.write("CONFIRMED FINDINGS:\n") f.write("-" * 18 + "\n") f.write("‚úÖ Henrik Sedin scored overtime goal on April 17, 2002\n") f.write(" ‚Ä¢ Game: Vancouver 4-3 Detroit\n") f.write(" ‚Ä¢ Time: 13:59 of overtime\n") f.write(" ‚Ä¢ Competition: 2002 Stanley Cup Playoffs\n") f.write(" ‚Ä¢ Source: Hockey Reference (confirmed)\n\n") f.write("MISSING INFORMATION:\n") f.write("-" * 20 + "\n") f.write("‚ùå Public complaints about the incident\n") f.write("‚ùå Identity of who made complaints\n") f.write("‚ùå Vancouver Canucks injury protocol changes\n") f.write("‚ùå Specific incident details beyond the overtime goal\n\n") f.write("SEARCH CHALLENGES:\n") f.write("-" * 18 + "\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ Persistent API rate limiting prevented comprehensive searches\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ Existing data sources limited to statistical information\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ No access to sports journalism archives or organizational records\n\n") f.write("CONCLUSION:\n") f.write("-" * 11 + "\n") f.write("While we confirmed Henrik Sedin's notable overtime goal performance\n") f.write("during the 2002 playoffs, the specific incident involving complaints\n") f.write("and protocol changes described in the PLAN could not be located\n") f.write("in available public sources. This may indicate the incident is\n") f.write("poorly documented online or may not have occurred as described.\n") print(f"üìÑ Summary saved to: {summary_file}") print(f"\nüèÅ FINAL ASSESSMENT COMPLETED") print(f"\nüìã CONCLUSION:") print(f"We have confirmed Henrik Sedin's overtime goal on April 17, 2002,") print(f"but were unable to locate the specific incident involving complaints") print(f"and injury protocol changes described in the PLAN. This suggests") print(f"either the incident is poorly documented in public sources or may") print(f"not have occurred as described.") print(f"\n‚úÖ DOCUMENTATION COMPLETE - All findings and limitations recorded")
