tester
2025-08-07 05:54:01
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Partial success - Code executed without errors and successfully scraped 4 out of 5 target sources (80% success rate), collecting 16,485 characters of content from Wikipedia and NHL.com. The scraping successfully identified the March 8, 2004 incident references and found 4 potential critics mentioned: Marc Crawford, Brian Burke, Gary Bettman, and Colin Campbell. However, the analysis revealed limited criticism patterns (only 1 match) and zero policy change patterns, which means the **PLAN** objective is only partially fulfilled. **PLAN** alignment: 40% - incident information gathered but insufficient detail on specific complaints and no Vancouver Canucks policy changes identified. The code properly saved results to workspace files for further analysis. Next steps: (1) Extract and analyze the full text content from the scraped data files to find more detailed criticism information, (2) Search for additional sources specifically focused on organizational responses and policy changes, (3) Deep dive into the identified critics' specific statements about the incident.
Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import time import json from datetime import datetime import os import re print("Todd Bertuzzi Incident Investigation - Web Scraping Approach") print("Searching for complaints and criticism regarding March 8, 2004 incident") print("Focus: Public critics and Vancouver Canucks policy changes") print("=" * 75) # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') # Define URLs to scrape for Todd Bertuzzi incident information target_urls = [ 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Todd_Bertuzzi%E2%80%93Steve_Moore_incident', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Todd_Bertuzzi', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_Moore_(ice_hockey)', 'https://www.hockey-reference.com/players/b/bertutt01.html', 'https://www.nhl.com/news/todd-bertuzzi-steve-moore-incident-march-8-2004/c-123456789' ] # Set up headers to mimic a real browser headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Store all scraped content scraped_data = [] successful_scrapes = 0 print(f"Starting web scraping from {len(target_urls)} sources...") print("=" * 60) # Scrape each target URL for i, url in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f"\nScraping source {i}/{len(target_urls)}: {url}") print("-" * 50) try: # Make request with timeout response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed {url}") # Parse HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for script in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() # Get page title title = soup.find('title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title found' # Get main content text text = soup.get_text() # Clean up text lines = (line.strip() for line in text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() for line in lines for phrase in line.split(" ")) clean_text = ' '.join(chunk for chunk in chunks if chunk) print(f"Page title: {page_title}") print(f"Content length: {len(clean_text)} characters") # Look for key terms related to criticism and complaints criticism_keywords = [ 'criticism', 'criticized', 'complaint', 'complained', 'condemned', 'spoke out', 'public outcry', 'backlash', 'controversy', 'outrage', 'denounced', 'disapproval', 'protest', 'objection', 'opposition' ] policy_keywords = [ 'policy change', 'protocol', 'safety measure', 'organizational change', 'injury reporting', 'player safety', 'conduct policy', 'rule change', 'procedure', 'guideline', 'reform', 'revision' ] # Search for criticism mentions criticism_found = [] for keyword in criticism_keywords: if keyword.lower() in clean_text.lower(): criticism_found.append(keyword) # Search for policy change mentions policy_found = [] for keyword in policy_keywords: if keyword.lower() in clean_text.lower(): policy_found.append(keyword) print(f"Criticism keywords found: {len(criticism_found)} - {criticism_found[:5]}") print(f"Policy keywords found: {len(policy_found)} - {policy_found[:5]}") # Extract specific sections about the incident incident_sections = [] text_lower = clean_text.lower() # Look for sections containing March 8, 2004 or related dates if 'march 8, 2004' in text_lower or 'march 2004' in text_lower: print("üìÖ FOUND MARCH 8, 2004 INCIDENT REFERENCE") # Extract paragraphs containing the incident date paragraphs = clean_text.split('\n') for para in paragraphs: if 'march 8, 2004' in para.lower() or 'march 2004' in para.lower(): incident_sections.append(para.strip()) # Look for Todd Bertuzzi and Steve Moore mentions if 'todd bertuzzi' in text_lower and 'steve moore' in text_lower: print("üë• FOUND BOTH TODD BERTUZZI AND STEVE MOORE REFERENCES") # Look for Vancouver Canucks mentions if 'vancouver canucks' in text_lower or 'canucks' in text_lower: print("üèí FOUND VANCOUVER CANUCKS REFERENCES") # Store the scraped data scraped_data.append({ 'url': url, 'title': page_title, 'content_length': len(clean_text), 'criticism_keywords': criticism_found, 'policy_keywords': policy_found, 'incident_sections': incident_sections, 'full_text': clean_text[:5000], # Store first 5000 chars for analysis 'scrape_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() }) successful_scrapes += 1 else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access {url} - Status code: {response.status_code}") except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e: print(f"‚ùå Error scraping {url}: {str(e)}") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Unexpected error with {url}: {str(e)}") # Add delay between requests time.sleep(2) print("=" * 60) print(f"\n\nüìä SCRAPING SUMMARY:") print(f"Total URLs attempted: {len(target_urls)}") print(f"Successful scrapes: {successful_scrapes}") print(f"Total content collected: {len(scraped_data)} sources") # Save scraped data to workspace timestamp = datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') scrape_file = f'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_scrape_data_{timestamp}.json' scrape_summary = { 'scrape_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_purpose': 'Web scraping for Todd Bertuzzi incident criticism and Vancouver Canucks policy changes', 'total_urls': len(target_urls), 'successful_scrapes': successful_scrapes, 'scraped_data': scraped_data } with open(scrape_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(scrape_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"Scraped data saved to: {scrape_file}") # Analyze the scraped content for specific information print("\n\nüîç ANALYZING SCRAPED CONTENT FOR CRITICISM AND POLICY CHANGES...") print("=" * 70) # Combine all text for comprehensive analysis all_text = ' '.join([data['full_text'] for data in scraped_data]) all_text_lower = all_text.lower() print(f"Total combined text length: {len(all_text)} characters") # Look for specific critics mentioned print("\nüë• SEARCHING FOR SPECIFIC CRITICS:") print("-" * 35) # Common hockey personalities who might have commented potential_critics = [ 'don cherry', 'ron maclean', 'bob mckenzie', 'pierre mcguire', 'kelly hrudey', 'glenn healy', 'mike milbury', 'barry melrose', 'marc crawford', 'pat quinn', 'brian burke', 'gary bettman', 'colin campbell', 'brendan shanahan', 'rob blake', 'markus naslund' ] critics_found = [] for critic in potential_critics: if critic in all_text_lower: critics_found.append(critic) print(f"‚úÖ Found mention of: {critic.title()}") if not critics_found: print("‚ùå No specific critics identified in initial scan") # Look for criticism language patterns print("\nüí¨ SEARCHING FOR CRITICISM PATTERNS:") print("-" * 40) criticism_patterns = [ r'criticized.*bertuzzi', r'condemned.*incident', r'spoke out.*against', r'public.*outcry', r'controversy.*surrounding', r'backlash.*from', r'disapproval.*of' ] criticism_matches = [] for pattern in criticism_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, all_text_lower) if matches: criticism_matches.extend(matches) print(f"üìù Found criticism pattern: {pattern} - {len(matches)} matches") # Look for policy change information print("\nüìã SEARCHING FOR POLICY CHANGES:") print("-" * 35) policy_patterns = [ r'policy.*change.*canucks', r'safety.*protocol.*vancouver', r'injury.*reporting.*procedure', r'organizational.*change.*after', r'conduct.*policy.*revised', r'player.*safety.*measure' ] policy_matches = [] for pattern in policy_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, all_text_lower) if matches: policy_matches.extend(matches) print(f"üìã Found policy pattern: {pattern} - {len(matches)} matches") if not policy_matches: print("‚ùå No specific policy change patterns found in initial scan") # Create detailed analysis report analysis_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_analysis.txt' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("TODD BERTUZZI INCIDENT - WEB SCRAPING ANALYSIS\n") f.write("=" * 50 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis Date: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Data Sources: {successful_scrapes} successfully scraped websites\n") f.write(f"Total Content: {len(all_text)} characters analyzed\n\n") f.write("INCIDENT OVERVIEW:\n") f.write("-" * 18 + "\n") f.write("Date: March 8, 2004\n") f.write("Incident: Todd Bertuzzi (Vancouver Canucks) attacked Steve Moore (Colorado Avalanche)\n") f.write("Location: GM Place, Vancouver\n") f.write("Result: Steve Moore suffered career-ending injuries\n\n") f.write("CRITICISM ANALYSIS:\n") f.write("-" * 20 + "\n") f.write(f"Critics identified: {len(critics_found)}\n") if critics_found: for critic in critics_found: f.write(f" - {critic.title()}\n") f.write(f"Criticism patterns found: {len(criticism_matches)}\n") f.write(f"Criticism keywords across sources: {sum(len(data['criticism_keywords']) for data in scraped_data)}\n\n") f.write("POLICY CHANGE ANALYSIS:\n") f.write("-" * 23 + "\n") f.write(f"Policy change patterns: {len(policy_matches)}\n") f.write(f"Policy keywords across sources: {sum(len(data['policy_keywords']) for data in scraped_data)}\n\n") f.write("SOURCE BREAKDOWN:\n") f.write("-" * 17 + "\n") for i, data in enumerate(scraped_data, 1): f.write(f"{i}. {data['title']}\n") f.write(f" URL: {data['url']}\n") f.write(f" Content: {data['content_length']} chars\n") f.write(f" Criticism keywords: {len(data['criticism_keywords'])}\n") f.write(f" Policy keywords: {len(data['policy_keywords'])}\n\n") print(f"\nüìÑ Files created:") print(f"‚Ä¢ Scraped data: {scrape_file}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Analysis report: {analysis_file}") print(f"\n‚úÖ WEB SCRAPING PHASE COMPLETED!") print(f"\nKey findings:") print(f"‚Ä¢ Successfully scraped {successful_scrapes} sources") print(f"‚Ä¢ Identified {len(critics_found)} potential critics: {critics_found}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Found {len(criticism_matches)} criticism patterns") print(f"‚Ä¢ Found {len(policy_matches)} policy change patterns") print(f"‚Ä¢ Total content analyzed: {len(all_text)} characters") print(f"\nNext steps:") print(f"1. Deep dive into specific criticism mentions") print(f"2. Extract detailed policy change information") print(f"3. Cross-reference critics with timeline of changes") print(f"4. Identify specific organizational responses by Vancouver Canucks")

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the scraped data file that was created scrape_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_scrape_data_20250807_055350.json' if os.path.exists(scrape_file): print("Found Todd Bertuzzi incident scraped data file. Inspecting structure...") print("=" * 70) # Load and inspect the file structure first with open(scrape_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure:") print(f"Keys in data: {list(data.keys())}") print(f"Scrape timestamp: {data.get('scrape_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Search purpose: {data.get('search_purpose', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total URLs: {data.get('total_urls', 'N/A')}") print(f"Successful scrapes: {data.get('successful_scrapes', 'N/A')}") if 'scraped_data' in data and len(data['scraped_data']) > 0: print(f"\nFirst scraped entry structure:") first_entry = data['scraped_data'][0] print(f"Keys in scraped entry: {list(first_entry.keys())}") print(f"Sample entry title: {first_entry.get('title', 'N/A')}") print(f"Sample entry URL: {first_entry.get('url', 'N/A')}") print(f"Content length: {first_entry.get('content_length', 'N/A')}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("DEEP ANALYSIS OF SCRAPED CONTENT FOR CRITICISM AND POLICY CHANGES") print("=" * 80) # Now let's analyze the scraped content in detail criticism_evidence = [] policy_evidence = [] critic_statements = [] organizational_responses = [] for i, source in enumerate(data['scraped_data'], 1): url = source.get('url', '') title = source.get('title', '') content = source.get('full_text', '') content_lower = content.lower() print(f"\nüîç ANALYZING SOURCE {i}: {title}") print(f"URL: {url}") print(f"Content length: {len(content)} characters") print("-" * 60) # Look for specific criticism mentions with context criticism_contexts = [] # Split content into sentences for better context extraction sentences = content.split('. ') for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Look for criticism-related sentences criticism_indicators = [ 'criticized', 'condemned', 'spoke out', 'complained', 'objected', 'disapproved', 'denounced', 'backlash', 'controversy', 'outrage', 'public outcry', 'protest', 'opposition' ] for indicator in criticism_indicators: if indicator in sentence_lower and ('bertuzzi' in sentence_lower or 'incident' in sentence_lower): criticism_contexts.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'indicator': indicator, 'source': title }) break if criticism_contexts: print(f"üì¢ FOUND {len(criticism_contexts)} CRITICISM CONTEXTS:") for j, context in enumerate(criticism_contexts[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f" {j}. {context['sentence'][:200]}...") print(f" Indicator: {context['indicator']}") criticism_evidence.extend(criticism_contexts) else: print(f"‚ùå No specific criticism contexts found") # Look for policy change mentions with context policy_contexts = [] for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Look for policy/organizational change indicators policy_indicators = [ 'policy change', 'protocol', 'safety measure', 'organizational change', 'injury reporting', 'conduct policy', 'rule change', 'procedure', 'guideline', 'reform', 'revision', 'implemented', 'established', 'new policy', 'safety protocol', 'player safety' ] for indicator in policy_indicators: if indicator in sentence_lower and ('canucks' in sentence_lower or 'vancouver' in sentence_lower or 'nhl' in sentence_lower): policy_contexts.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'indicator': indicator, 'source': title }) break if policy_contexts: print(f"üìã FOUND {len(policy_contexts)} POLICY CHANGE CONTEXTS:") for j, context in enumerate(policy_contexts[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f" {j}. {context['sentence'][:200]}...") print(f" Indicator: {context['indicator']}") policy_evidence.extend(policy_contexts) else: print(f"‚ùå No specific policy change contexts found") # Look for specific critic statements critics = ['marc crawford', 'brian burke', 'gary bettman', 'colin campbell', 'don cherry', 'ron maclean', 'bob mckenzie', 'pat quinn'] critic_mentions = [] for critic in critics: if critic in content_lower: # Find sentences mentioning this critic for sentence in sentences: if critic in sentence.lower(): critic_mentions.append({ 'critic': critic.title(), 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'source': title }) break if critic_mentions: print(f"üë• FOUND {len(critic_mentions)} CRITIC MENTIONS:") for mention in critic_mentions: print(f" ‚Ä¢ {mention['critic']}: {mention['sentence'][:150]}...") critic_statements.extend(critic_mentions) # Look for Vancouver Canucks organizational responses canucks_responses = [] for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() if ('canucks' in sentence_lower or 'vancouver' in sentence_lower) and \ any(word in sentence_lower for word in ['response', 'responded', 'statement', 'announced', 'implemented', 'changed', 'revised']): canucks_responses.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'source': title }) if canucks_responses: print(f"üèí FOUND {len(canucks_responses)} CANUCKS ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:") for response in canucks_responses[:2]: # Show top 2 print(f" ‚Ä¢ {response['sentence'][:150]}...") organizational_responses.extend(canucks_responses) print("=" * 60) # Create comprehensive analysis summary print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print("=" * 50) print(f"Total criticism evidence found: {len(criticism_evidence)}") print(f"Total policy change evidence: {len(policy_evidence)}") print(f"Total critic statements: {len(critic_statements)}") print(f"Total organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)}") # Display key findings if criticism_evidence: print(f"\nüí¨ KEY CRITICISM EVIDENCE:") print("-" * 30) for i, evidence in enumerate(criticism_evidence[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {evidence['source']}") print(f" Indicator: {evidence['indicator']}") print(f" Context: {evidence['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if policy_evidence: print(f"\nüìã KEY POLICY CHANGE EVIDENCE:") print("-" * 32) for i, evidence in enumerate(policy_evidence[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {evidence['source']}") print(f" Indicator: {evidence['indicator']}") print(f" Context: {evidence['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if critic_statements: print(f"\nüë• IDENTIFIED CRITICS AND THEIR STATEMENTS:") print("-" * 45) for i, statement in enumerate(critic_statements[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Critic: {statement['critic']}") print(f" Source: {statement['source']}") print(f" Statement: {statement['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if organizational_responses: print(f"\nüèí VANCOUVER CANUCKS ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:") print("-" * 48) for i, response in enumerate(organizational_responses[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {response['source']}") print(f" Response: {response['sentence'][:200]}...") print() # Create detailed findings report findings_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_detailed_findings.json' detailed_findings = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'incident_details': { 'date': 'March 8, 2004', 'location': 'GM Place, Vancouver', 'teams': 'Vancouver Canucks vs Colorado Avalanche', 'key_players': 'Todd Bertuzzi (Vancouver) and Steve Moore (Colorado)' }, 'criticism_evidence': criticism_evidence, 'policy_evidence': policy_evidence, 'critic_statements': critic_statements, 'organizational_responses': organizational_responses, 'analysis_summary': { 'total_sources_analyzed': len(data['scraped_data']), 'criticism_instances': len(criticism_evidence), 'policy_instances': len(policy_evidence), 'identified_critics': len(critic_statements), 'organizational_responses': len(organizational_responses) } } with open(findings_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(detailed_findings, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) # Create summary report for planner summary_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_final_summary.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("TODD BERTUZZI INCIDENT - COMPLAINTS AND CRITICISM ANALYSIS\n") f.write("=" * 60 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis completed: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Sources analyzed: {len(data['scraped_data'])} websites\n\n") f.write("INCIDENT OVERVIEW:\n") f.write("-" * 18 + "\n") f.write("Date: March 8, 2004\n") f.write("Incident: Todd Bertuzzi (Vancouver Canucks) attacked Steve Moore (Colorado Avalanche)\n") f.write("Location: GM Place, Vancouver\n") f.write("Result: Steve Moore suffered career-ending neck injuries\n\n") f.write("CRITICISM AND COMPLAINTS FOUND:\n") f.write("-" * 35 + "\n") f.write(f"Total criticism instances: {len(criticism_evidence)}\n") if criticism_evidence: f.write("Key criticism evidence:\n") for i, evidence in enumerate(criticism_evidence[:3], 1): f.write(f"{i}. {evidence['sentence'][:150]}...\n") f.write(f" (Source: {evidence['source']})\n") else: f.write("Limited specific criticism evidence found in scraped sources.\n") f.write("\n") f.write("IDENTIFIED CRITICS:\n") f.write("-" * 19 + "\n") if critic_statements: unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) f.write(f"Critics mentioned: {', '.join(unique_critics)}\n") for critic in unique_critics: critic_stmts = [stmt for stmt in critic_statements if stmt['critic'] == critic] f.write(f"\n{critic}:\n") for stmt in critic_stmts[:2]: f.write(f" - {stmt['sentence'][:100]}...\n") else: f.write("No specific critic statements identified in detail.\n") f.write("\n") f.write("POLICY CHANGES AND ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:\n") f.write("-" * 45 + "\n") f.write(f"Policy change instances: {len(policy_evidence)}\n") f.write(f"Organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)}\n") if policy_evidence or organizational_responses: f.write("Evidence found:\n") for evidence in (policy_evidence + organizational_responses)[:3]: f.write(f" - {evidence['sentence'][:100]}...\n") else: f.write("Limited evidence of specific Vancouver Canucks policy changes found.\n") f.write("\n") f.write("ANALYSIS LIMITATIONS:\n") f.write("-" * 21 + "\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ Analysis based on publicly available Wikipedia and NHL.com content\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ May not capture all media criticism from 2004 time period\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ Limited access to contemporary news reports and interviews\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ Policy changes may have been internal and not publicly documented\n") print(f"\nüìÑ Analysis files created:") print(f"‚Ä¢ Detailed findings: {findings_file}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Summary report: {summary_file}") print(f"\nüèÅ FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS:") print("=" * 40) print(f"üìä Analysis Statistics:") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Sources analyzed: {len(data['scraped_data'])}") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Criticism evidence: {len(criticism_evidence)} instances") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Policy change evidence: {len(policy_evidence)} instances") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Critic statements: {len(critic_statements)} identified") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)} found") if len(criticism_evidence) > 0 or len(critic_statements) > 0: print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found evidence of criticism and complaints") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED SUCCESS: Minimal criticism evidence in available sources") if len(policy_evidence) > 0 or len(organizational_responses) > 0: print(f"‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found evidence of organizational responses") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED SUCCESS: Minimal policy change evidence in available sources") print(f"\nüìù Key Findings Summary:") if critic_statements: unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) print(f" ‚Ä¢ Critics identified: {', '.join(unique_critics)}") print(f"\nüîç Recommendation: The analysis reveals limited detailed information") print(f"about specific complaints and policy changes in the scraped sources.") print(f"This may be due to the incident's age (2004) and the focus of") print(f"available sources on factual reporting rather than criticism analysis.") else: print(f"Error: Scraped data file {scrape_file} not found.") print("Available files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: print(" - No workspace directory found")
Execution Output
Code Output: Found Todd Bertuzzi incident scraped data file. Wikipedia Sample entry URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Todd_Bertuzzi%E2%80%93Steve_Moore_incident Content length: 30485 ================================================================================ DEEP ANALYSIS OF SCRAPED CONTENT FOR CRITICISM AND POLICY CHANGES ================================================================================ üîç ANALYZING SOURCE 1: Todd Bertuzzi‚ÄìSteve Moore incident - Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code encountered a NameError on line 146 where 'sentence_lower' is not defined within a generator expression. The code was attempting to analyze scraped data and successfully loaded the Todd Bertuzzi incident file, identified 4 critics (Marc Crawford, Brian Burke, Gary Bettman, Colin Campbell), and began processing the content. However, the analysis crashed when trying to find organizational responses due to a variable scope issue in the list comprehension. **PLAN** alignment: 60% - good progress identifying critics and analyzing scraped content, but the detailed analysis couldn't complete. The code did show promising initial findings with criticism evidence and critic identification before the error. Immediate fix needed: Correct the variable scope issue by defining 'sentence_lower' properly within the generator expression or restructuring the logic to avoid the scoping problem. The analysis approach is sound and the data structure looks good for completing the **PLAN** objectives once the bug is fixed.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the scraped data file that was created scrape_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_scrape_data_20250807_055350.json' if os.path.exists(scrape_file): print("Found Todd Bertuzzi incident scraped data file. Inspecting structure...") print("=" * 70) # Load and inspect the file structure first with open(scrape_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure:") print(f"Keys in data: {list(data.keys())}") print(f"Scrape timestamp: {data.get('scrape_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Search purpose: {data.get('search_purpose', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total URLs: {data.get('total_urls', 'N/A')}") print(f"Successful scrapes: {data.get('successful_scrapes', 'N/A')}") if 'scraped_data' in data and len(data['scraped_data']) > 0: print(f"\nFirst scraped entry structure:") first_entry = data['scraped_data'][0] print(f"Keys in scraped entry: {list(first_entry.keys())}") print(f"Sample entry title: {first_entry.get('title', 'N/A')}") print(f"Sample entry URL: {first_entry.get('url', 'N/A')}") print(f"Content length: {first_entry.get('content_length', 'N/A')}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("DEEP ANALYSIS OF SCRAPED CONTENT FOR CRITICISM AND POLICY CHANGES") print("=" * 80) # Now let's analyze the scraped content in detail criticism_evidence = [] policy_evidence = [] critic_statements = [] organizational_responses = [] for i, source in enumerate(data['scraped_data'], 1): url = source.get('url', '') title = source.get('title', '') content = source.get('full_text', '') content_lower = content.lower() print(f"\nüîç ANALYZING SOURCE {i}: {title}") print(f"URL: {url}") print(f"Content length: {len(content)} characters") print("-" * 60) # Look for specific criticism mentions with context criticism_contexts = [] # Split content into sentences for better context extraction sentences = content.split('. ') for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Look for criticism-related sentences criticism_indicators = [ 'criticized', 'condemned', 'spoke out', 'complained', 'objected', 'disapproved', 'denounced', 'backlash', 'controversy', 'outrage', 'public outcry', 'protest', 'opposition' ] for indicator in criticism_indicators: if indicator in sentence_lower and ('bertuzzi' in sentence_lower or 'incident' in sentence_lower): criticism_contexts.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'indicator': indicator, 'source': title }) break if criticism_contexts: print(f"üì¢ FOUND {len(criticism_contexts)} CRITICISM CONTEXTS:") for j, context in enumerate(criticism_contexts[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f" {j}. {context['sentence'][:200]}...") print(f" Indicator: {context['indicator']}") criticism_evidence.extend(criticism_contexts) else: print(f"‚ùå No specific criticism contexts found") # Look for policy change mentions with context policy_contexts = [] for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Look for policy/organizational change indicators policy_indicators = [ 'policy change', 'protocol', 'safety measure', 'organizational change', 'injury reporting', 'conduct policy', 'rule change', 'procedure', 'guideline', 'reform', 'revision', 'implemented', 'established', 'new policy', 'safety protocol', 'player safety' ] for indicator in policy_indicators: if indicator in sentence_lower and ('canucks' in sentence_lower or 'vancouver' in sentence_lower or 'nhl' in sentence_lower): policy_contexts.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'indicator': indicator, 'source': title }) break if policy_contexts: print(f"üìã FOUND {len(policy_contexts)} POLICY CHANGE CONTEXTS:") for j, context in enumerate(policy_contexts[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f" {j}. {context['sentence'][:200]}...") print(f" Indicator: {context['indicator']}") policy_evidence.extend(policy_contexts) else: print(f"‚ùå No specific policy change contexts found") # Look for specific critic statements critics = ['marc crawford', 'brian burke', 'gary bettman', 'colin campbell', 'don cherry', 'ron maclean', 'bob mckenzie', 'pat quinn'] critic_mentions = [] for critic in critics: if critic in content_lower: # Find sentences mentioning this critic for sentence in sentences: if critic in sentence.lower(): critic_mentions.append({ 'critic': critic.title(), 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'source': title }) break if critic_mentions: print(f"üë• FOUND {len(critic_mentions)} CRITIC MENTIONS:") for mention in critic_mentions: print(f" ‚Ä¢ {mention['critic']}: {mention['sentence'][:150]}...") critic_statements.extend(critic_mentions) # Look for Vancouver Canucks organizational responses canucks_responses = [] for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() if ('canucks' in sentence_lower or 'vancouver' in sentence_lower) and \ any(word in sentence_lower for word in ['response', 'responded', 'statement', 'announced', 'implemented', 'changed', 'revised']): canucks_responses.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'source': title }) if canucks_responses: print(f"üèí FOUND {len(canucks_responses)} CANUCKS ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:") for response in canucks_responses[:2]: # Show top 2 print(f" ‚Ä¢ {response['sentence'][:150]}...") organizational_responses.extend(canucks_responses) print("=" * 60) # Create comprehensive analysis summary print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print("=" * 50) print(f"Total criticism evidence found: {len(criticism_evidence)}") print(f"Total policy change evidence: {len(policy_evidence)}") print(f"Total critic statements: {len(critic_statements)}") print(f"Total organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)}") # Display key findings if criticism_evidence: print(f"\nüí¨ KEY CRITICISM EVIDENCE:") print("-" * 30) for i, evidence in enumerate(criticism_evidence[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {evidence['source']}") print(f" Indicator: {evidence['indicator']}") print(f" Context: {evidence['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if policy_evidence: print(f"\nüìã KEY POLICY CHANGE EVIDENCE:") print("-" * 32) for i, evidence in enumerate(policy_evidence[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {evidence['source']}") print(f" Indicator: {evidence['indicator']}") print(f" Context: {evidence['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if critic_statements: print(f"\nüë• IDENTIFIED CRITICS AND THEIR STATEMENTS:") print("-" * 45) for i, statement in enumerate(critic_statements[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Critic: {statement['critic']}") print(f" Source: {statement['source']}") print(f" Statement: {statement['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if organizational_responses: print(f"\nüèí VANCOUVER CANUCKS ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:") print("-" * 48) for i, response in enumerate(organizational_responses[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {response['source']}") print(f" Response: {response['sentence'][:200]}...") print() # Create detailed findings report findings_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_detailed_findings.json' detailed_findings = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'incident_details': { 'date': 'March 8, 2004', 'location': 'GM Place, Vancouver', 'teams': 'Vancouver Canucks vs Colorado Avalanche', 'key_players': 'Todd Bertuzzi (Vancouver) and Steve Moore (Colorado)' }, 'criticism_evidence': criticism_evidence, 'policy_evidence': policy_evidence, 'critic_statements': critic_statements, 'organizational_responses': organizational_responses, 'analysis_summary': { 'total_sources_analyzed': len(data['scraped_data']), 'criticism_instances': len(criticism_evidence), 'policy_instances': len(policy_evidence), 'identified_critics': len(critic_statements), 'organizational_responses': len(organizational_responses) } } with open(findings_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(detailed_findings, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) # Create summary report for planner summary_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_final_summary.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("TODD BERTUZZI INCIDENT - COMPLAINTS AND CRITICISM ANALYSIS\n") f.write("=" * 60 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis completed: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Sources analyzed: {len(data['scraped_data'])} websites\n\n") f.write("INCIDENT OVERVIEW:\n") f.write("-" * 18 + "\n") f.write("Date: March 8, 2004\n") f.write("Incident: Todd Bertuzzi (Vancouver Canucks) attacked Steve Moore (Colorado Avalanche)\n") f.write("Location: GM Place, Vancouver\n") f.write("Result: Steve Moore suffered career-ending neck injuries\n\n") f.write("CRITICISM AND COMPLAINTS FOUND:\n") f.write("-" * 35 + "\n") f.write(f"Total criticism instances: {len(criticism_evidence)}\n") if criticism_evidence: f.write("Key criticism evidence:\n") for i, evidence in enumerate(criticism_evidence[:3], 1): f.write(f"{i}. {evidence['sentence'][:150]}...\n") f.write(f" (Source: {evidence['source']})\n") else: f.write("Limited specific criticism evidence found in scraped sources.\n") f.write("\n") f.write("IDENTIFIED CRITICS:\n") f.write("-" * 19 + "\n") if critic_statements: unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) f.write(f"Critics mentioned: {', '.join(unique_critics)}\n") for critic in unique_critics: critic_stmts = [stmt for stmt in critic_statements if stmt['critic'] == critic] f.write(f"\n{critic}:\n") for stmt in critic_stmts[:2]: f.write(f" - {stmt['sentence'][:100]}...\n") else: f.write("No specific critic statements identified in detail.\n") f.write("\n") f.write("POLICY CHANGES AND ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:\n") f.write("-" * 45 + "\n") f.write(f"Policy change instances: {len(policy_evidence)}\n") f.write(f"Organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)}\n") if policy_evidence or organizational_responses: f.write("Evidence found:\n") for evidence in (policy_evidence + organizational_responses)[:3]: f.write(f" - {evidence['sentence'][:100]}...\n") else: f.write("Limited evidence of specific Vancouver Canucks policy changes found.\n") f.write("\n") f.write("ANALYSIS LIMITATIONS:\n") f.write("-" * 21 + "\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ Analysis based on publicly available Wikipedia and NHL.com content\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ May not capture all media criticism from 2004 time period\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ Limited access to contemporary news reports and interviews\n") f.write("‚Ä¢ Policy changes may have been internal and not publicly documented\n") print(f"\nüìÑ Analysis files created:") print(f"‚Ä¢ Detailed findings: {findings_file}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Summary report: {summary_file}") print(f"\nüèÅ FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS:") print("=" * 40) print(f"üìä Analysis Statistics:") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Sources analyzed: {len(data['scraped_data'])}") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Criticism evidence: {len(criticism_evidence)} instances") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Policy change evidence: {len(policy_evidence)} instances") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Critic statements: {len(critic_statements)} identified") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)} found") if len(criticism_evidence) > 0 or len(critic_statements) > 0: print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found evidence of criticism and complaints") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED SUCCESS: Minimal criticism evidence in available sources") if len(policy_evidence) > 0 or len(organizational_responses) > 0: print(f"‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found evidence of organizational responses") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED SUCCESS: Minimal policy change evidence in available sources") print(f"\nüìù Key Findings Summary:") if critic_statements: unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) print(f" ‚Ä¢ Critics identified: {', '.join(unique_critics)}") print(f"\nüîç Recommendation: The analysis reveals limited detailed information") print(f"about specific complaints and policy changes in the scraped sources.") print(f"This may be due to the incident's age (2004) and the focus of") print(f"available sources on factual reporting rather than criticism analysis.") else: print(f"Error: Scraped data file {scrape_file} not found.") print("Available files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: print(" - No workspace directory found")

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the scraped data file that was created scrape_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_scrape_data_20250807_055350.json' if os.path.exists(scrape_file): print("Found Todd Bertuzzi incident scraped data file. Inspecting structure...") print("=" * 70) # Load and inspect the file structure first with open(scrape_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure:") print(f"Keys in data: {list(data.keys())}") print(f"Scrape timestamp: {data.get('scrape_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Search purpose: {data.get('search_purpose', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total URLs: {data.get('total_urls', 'N/A')}") print(f"Successful scrapes: {data.get('successful_scrapes', 'N/A')}") if 'scraped_data' in data and len(data['scraped_data']) > 0: print(f"\nFirst scraped entry structure:") first_entry = data['scraped_data'][0] print(f"Keys in scraped entry: {list(first_entry.keys())}") print(f"Sample entry title: {first_entry.get('title', 'N/A')}") print(f"Sample entry URL: {first_entry.get('url', 'N/A')}") print(f"Content length: {first_entry.get('content_length', 'N/A')}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("DEEP ANALYSIS OF SCRAPED CONTENT FOR CRITICISM AND POLICY CHANGES") print("=" * 80) # Now let's analyze the scraped content in detail criticism_evidence = [] policy_evidence = [] critic_statements = [] organizational_responses = [] for i, source in enumerate(data['scraped_data'], 1): url = source.get('url', '') title = source.get('title', '') content = source.get('full_text', '') content_lower = content.lower() print(f"\nüîç ANALYZING SOURCE {i}: {title}") print(f"URL: {url}") print(f"Content length: {len(content)} characters") print("-" * 60) # Look for specific criticism mentions with context criticism_contexts = [] # Split content into sentences for better context extraction sentences = content.split('. ') for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Look for criticism-related sentences criticism_indicators = [ 'criticized', 'condemned', 'spoke out', 'complained', 'objected', 'disapproved', 'denounced', 'backlash', 'controversy', 'outrage', 'public outcry', 'protest', 'opposition' ] for indicator in criticism_indicators: if indicator in sentence_lower and ('bertuzzi' in sentence_lower or 'incident' in sentence_lower): criticism_contexts.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'indicator': indicator, 'source': title }) break if criticism_contexts: print(f"üì¢ FOUND {len(criticism_contexts)} CRITICISM CONTEXTS:") for j, context in enumerate(criticism_contexts[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f" {j}. {context['sentence'][:200]}...") print(f" Indicator: {context['indicator']}") criticism_evidence.extend(criticism_contexts) else: print(f"‚ùå No specific criticism contexts found") # Look for policy change mentions with context policy_contexts = [] for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Look for policy/organizational change indicators policy_indicators = [ 'policy change', 'protocol', 'safety measure', 'organizational change', 'injury reporting', 'conduct policy', 'rule change', 'procedure', 'guideline', 'reform', 'revision', 'implemented', 'established', 'new policy', 'safety protocol', 'player safety' ] for indicator in policy_indicators: if indicator in sentence_lower and ('canucks' in sentence_lower or 'vancouver' in sentence_lower or 'nhl' in sentence_lower): policy_contexts.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'indicator': indicator, 'source': title }) break if policy_contexts: print(f"üìã FOUND {len(policy_contexts)} POLICY CHANGE CONTEXTS:") for j, context in enumerate(policy_contexts[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f" {j}. {context['sentence'][:200]}...") print(f" Indicator: {context['indicator']}") policy_evidence.extend(policy_contexts) else: print(f"‚ùå No specific policy change contexts found") # Look for specific critic statements critics = ['marc crawford', 'brian burke', 'gary bettman', 'colin campbell', 'don cherry', 'ron maclean', 'bob mckenzie', 'pat quinn'] critic_mentions = [] for critic in critics: if critic in content_lower: # Find sentences mentioning this critic for sentence in sentences: if critic in sentence.lower(): critic_mentions.append({ 'critic': critic.title(), 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'source': title }) break if critic_mentions: print(f"üë• FOUND {len(critic_mentions)} CRITIC MENTIONS:") for mention in critic_mentions: print(f" ‚Ä¢ {mention['critic']}: {mention['sentence'][:150]}...") critic_statements.extend(critic_mentions) # Look for Vancouver Canucks organizational responses - FIX THE SCOPE ISSUE canucks_responses = [] for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Define sentence_lower here properly response_keywords = ['response', 'responded', 'statement', 'announced', 'implemented', 'changed', 'revised'] if ('canucks' in sentence_lower or 'vancouver' in sentence_lower): for keyword in response_keywords: if keyword in sentence_lower: canucks_responses.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'source': title }) break if canucks_responses: print(f"üèí FOUND {len(canucks_responses)} CANUCKS ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:") for response in canucks_responses[:2]: # Show top 2 print(f" ‚Ä¢ {response['sentence'][:150]}...") organizational_responses.extend(canucks_responses) print("=" * 60) # Create comprehensive analysis summary print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print("=" * 50) print(f"Total criticism evidence found: {len(criticism_evidence)}") print(f"Total policy change evidence: {len(policy_evidence)}") print(f"Total critic statements: {len(critic_statements)}") print(f"Total organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)}") # Display key findings if criticism_evidence: print(f"\nüí¨ KEY CRITICISM EVIDENCE:") print("-" * 30) for i, evidence in enumerate(criticism_evidence[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {evidence['source']}") print(f" Indicator: {evidence['indicator']}") print(f" Context: {evidence['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if policy_evidence: print(f"\nüìã KEY POLICY CHANGE EVIDENCE:") print("-" * 32) for i, evidence in enumerate(policy_evidence[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {evidence['source']}") print(f" Indicator: {evidence['indicator']}") print(f" Context: {evidence['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if critic_statements: print(f"\nüë• IDENTIFIED CRITICS AND THEIR STATEMENTS:") print("-" * 45) unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) print(f"Critics identified: {', '.join(unique_critics)}") print() for critic in unique_critics: critic_stmts = [stmt for stmt in critic_statements if stmt['critic'] == critic] print(f"üéØ {critic}:") for j, statement in enumerate(critic_stmts[:2], 1): print(f" {j}. Source: {statement['source']}") print(f" Statement: {statement['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if organizational_responses: print(f"\nüèí VANCOUVER CANUCKS ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:") print("-" * 48) for i, response in enumerate(organizational_responses[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {response['source']}") print(f" Response: {response['sentence'][:200]}...") print() # Search for specific complaint patterns in the content print(f"\nüîç SEARCHING FOR SPECIFIC COMPLAINT PATTERNS:") print("-" * 50) all_content = ' '.join([source.get('full_text', '') for source in data['scraped_data']]) all_content_lower = all_content.lower() # Look for specific complaint-related phrases complaint_patterns = [ 'public criticized', 'media criticized', 'fans criticized', 'players criticized', 'coaches criticized', 'officials criticized', 'league criticized', 'nhl criticized', 'handling of the incident', 'response to the incident', 'incident was criticized', 'controversy surrounding', 'backlash against', 'outcry over', 'condemned the', 'spoke out against', 'disapproval of', 'criticism of bertuzzi', 'criticism of canucks' ] found_complaints = [] for pattern in complaint_patterns: if pattern in all_content_lower: found_complaints.append(pattern) print(f"‚úÖ Found complaint pattern: '{pattern}'") if not found_complaints: print("‚ùå No specific complaint patterns found in combined content") # Look for policy change indicators print(f"\nüìã SEARCHING FOR POLICY CHANGE INDICATORS:") print("-" * 45) policy_change_patterns = [ 'canucks changed', 'vancouver implemented', 'new safety', 'revised policy', 'organizational change', 'protocol change', 'injury protocol', 'player safety measure', 'conduct policy', 'disciplinary action', 'team policy', 'safety guideline' ] found_policy_changes = [] for pattern in policy_change_patterns: if pattern in all_content_lower: found_policy_changes.append(pattern) print(f"‚úÖ Found policy change pattern: '{pattern}'") if not found_policy_changes: print("‚ùå No specific policy change patterns found in combined content") # Create detailed findings report findings_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_detailed_findings.json' detailed_findings = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'incident_details': { 'date': 'March 8, 2004', 'location': 'GM Place, Vancouver', 'teams': 'Vancouver Canucks vs Colorado Avalanche', 'key_players': 'Todd Bertuzzi (Vancouver) and Steve Moore (Colorado)' }, 'criticism_evidence': criticism_evidence, 'policy_evidence': policy_evidence, 'critic_statements': critic_statements, 'organizational_responses': organizational_responses, 'complaint_patterns_found': found_complaints, 'policy_change_patterns_found': found_policy_changes, 'analysis_summary': { 'total_sources_analyzed': len(data['scraped_data']), 'criticism_instances': len(criticism_evidence), 'policy_instances': len(policy_evidence), 'identified_critics': len(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])), 'organizational_responses': len(organizational_responses), 'complaint_patterns': len(found_complaints), 'policy_patterns': len(found_policy_changes) } } with open(findings_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(detailed_findings, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) # Create summary report for planner summary_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_final_summary.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("TODD BERTUZZI INCIDENT - COMPLAINTS AND CRITICISM ANALYSIS\n") f.write("=" * 60 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis completed: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Sources analyzed: {len(data['scraped_data'])} websites\n\n") f.write("INCIDENT OVERVIEW:\n") f.write("-" * 18 + "\n") f.write("Date: March 8, 2004\n") f.write("Incident: Todd Bertuzzi (Vancouver Canucks) attacked Steve Moore (Colorado Avalanche)\n") f.write("Location: GM Place, Vancouver\n") f.write("Result: Steve Moore suffered career-ending neck injuries\n\n") f.write("IDENTIFIED CRITICS:\n") f.write("-" * 19 + "\n") if critic_statements: unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) f.write(f"Critics mentioned in sources: {', '.join(unique_critics)}\n\n") for critic in unique_critics: critic_stmts = [stmt for stmt in critic_statements if stmt['critic'] == critic] f.write(f"{critic}:\n") for stmt in critic_stmts[:2]: f.write(f" - {stmt['sentence'][:150]}...\n") f.write(f" (Source: {stmt['source']})\n") f.write("\n") else: f.write("No specific critic statements identified in detail.\n\n") f.write("CRITICISM AND COMPLAINTS FOUND:\n") f.write("-" * 35 + "\n") f.write(f"Criticism evidence instances: {len(criticism_evidence)}\n") f.write(f"Complaint patterns found: {len(found_complaints)}\n") if criticism_evidence: f.write("Key criticism evidence:\n") for i, evidence in enumerate(criticism_evidence[:3], 1): f.write(f"{i}. {evidence['sentence'][:150]}...\n") f.write(f" (Indicator: {evidence['indicator']}, Source: {evidence['source']})\n") if found_complaints: f.write(f"Complaint patterns: {', '.join(found_complaints)}\n") f.write("\n") f.write("POLICY CHANGES AND ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:\n") f.write("-" * 45 + "\n") f.write(f"Policy change instances: {len(policy_evidence)}\n") f.write(f"Organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)}\n") f.write(f"Policy change patterns: {len(found_policy_changes)}\n") if policy_evidence or organizational_responses: f.write("Evidence found:\n") for evidence in (policy_evidence + organizational_responses)[:3]: f.write(f" - {evidence['sentence'][:150]}...\n") if found_policy_changes: f.write(f"Policy patterns: {', '.join(found_policy_changes)}\n") else: f.write("Limited evidence of specific Vancouver Canucks policy changes found.\n") f.write("\n") f.write("ANALYSIS CONCLUSION:\n") f.write("-" * 20 + "\n") f.write("Based on the scraped sources, the analysis identified:\n") f.write(f"‚Ä¢ {len(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements]))} key figures mentioned in relation to the incident\n") f.write(f"‚Ä¢ {len(criticism_evidence)} instances of criticism language\n") f.write(f"‚Ä¢ {len(organizational_responses)} organizational response mentions\n") f.write(f"‚Ä¢ {len(found_complaints)} complaint-related patterns\n") f.write("\nLimitations: Analysis based on publicly available sources may not\n") f.write("capture all contemporary criticism or internal policy changes.\n") print(f"\nüìÑ Analysis files created:") print(f"‚Ä¢ Detailed findings: {findings_file}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Summary report: {summary_file}") print(f"\nüèÅ FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS:") print("=" * 40) print(f"üìä Analysis Statistics:") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Sources analyzed: {len(data['scraped_data'])}") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Critics identified: {len(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements]))}") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Criticism evidence: {len(criticism_evidence)} instances") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Policy change evidence: {len(policy_evidence)} instances") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)} found") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Complaint patterns: {len(found_complaints)} identified") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Policy change patterns: {len(found_policy_changes)} identified") if len(critic_statements) > 0: unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Identified key figures - {', '.join(unique_critics)}") if len(criticism_evidence) > 0 or len(found_complaints) > 0: print(f"‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found evidence of criticism and complaints") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED: Minimal criticism evidence in available sources") if len(policy_evidence) > 0 or len(organizational_responses) > 0 or len(found_policy_changes) > 0: print(f"‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found evidence of organizational responses") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED: Minimal policy change evidence in available sources") print(f"\nüìù Key Findings Summary:") if critic_statements: unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) print(f" ‚Ä¢ Key figures mentioned: {', '.join(unique_critics)}") if found_complaints: print(f" ‚Ä¢ Complaint patterns found: {len(found_complaints)}") if found_policy_changes: print(f" ‚Ä¢ Policy change patterns: {len(found_policy_changes)}") else: print(f"Error: Scraped data file {scrape_file} not found.") print("Available files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: print(" - No workspace directory found")
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed comprehensive analysis of the Todd Bertuzzi incident scraped data. The analysis successfully processed 4 sources and identified key findings: (1) Found 4 critics mentioned - Gary Bettman, Colin Campbell, Brian Burke, and Marc Crawford, (2) Identified 1 instance of criticism evidence where 'Canucks head coach Marc Crawford and general manager Brian Burke publicly criticized the non-call by the referees', (3) Found 1 organizational response regarding NHL suspension announcements, (4) Detected 1 policy change pattern related to 'disciplinary action'. **PLAN** alignment: 85% complete - successfully identified public critics and some criticism, though limited evidence of specific Vancouver Canucks policy changes. The code created comprehensive analysis files (detailed_findings.json and final_summary.txt) with 16,485 characters of analyzed content. Key achievement: Identified specific critics who spoke out about the incident handling, particularly Marc Crawford and Brian Burke's public criticism of referee decisions. The analysis reveals the main limitation is that most policy changes may have been internal/undocumented rather than publicly reported. The investigation has substantially fulfilled the **PLAN** requirements by documenting who criticized the incident and providing evidence of organizational responses, though more detailed policy change information would strengthen the findings.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the scraped data file that was created scrape_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_scrape_data_20250807_055350.json' if os.path.exists(scrape_file): print("Found Todd Bertuzzi incident scraped data file. Inspecting structure...") print("=" * 70) # Load and inspect the file structure first with open(scrape_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure:") print(f"Keys in data: {list(data.keys())}") print(f"Scrape timestamp: {data.get('scrape_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Search purpose: {data.get('search_purpose', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total URLs: {data.get('total_urls', 'N/A')}") print(f"Successful scrapes: {data.get('successful_scrapes', 'N/A')}") if 'scraped_data' in data and len(data['scraped_data']) > 0: print(f"\nFirst scraped entry structure:") first_entry = data['scraped_data'][0] print(f"Keys in scraped entry: {list(first_entry.keys())}") print(f"Sample entry title: {first_entry.get('title', 'N/A')}") print(f"Sample entry URL: {first_entry.get('url', 'N/A')}") print(f"Content length: {first_entry.get('content_length', 'N/A')}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("DEEP ANALYSIS OF SCRAPED CONTENT FOR CRITICISM AND POLICY CHANGES") print("=" * 80) # Now let's analyze the scraped content in detail criticism_evidence = [] policy_evidence = [] critic_statements = [] organizational_responses = [] for i, source in enumerate(data['scraped_data'], 1): url = source.get('url', '') title = source.get('title', '') content = source.get('full_text', '') content_lower = content.lower() print(f"\nüîç ANALYZING SOURCE {i}: {title}") print(f"URL: {url}") print(f"Content length: {len(content)} characters") print("-" * 60) # Look for specific criticism mentions with context criticism_contexts = [] # Split content into sentences for better context extraction sentences = content.split('. ') for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Look for criticism-related sentences criticism_indicators = [ 'criticized', 'condemned', 'spoke out', 'complained', 'objected', 'disapproved', 'denounced', 'backlash', 'controversy', 'outrage', 'public outcry', 'protest', 'opposition' ] for indicator in criticism_indicators: if indicator in sentence_lower and ('bertuzzi' in sentence_lower or 'incident' in sentence_lower): criticism_contexts.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'indicator': indicator, 'source': title }) break if criticism_contexts: print(f"üì¢ FOUND {len(criticism_contexts)} CRITICISM CONTEXTS:") for j, context in enumerate(criticism_contexts[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f" {j}. {context['sentence'][:200]}...") print(f" Indicator: {context['indicator']}") criticism_evidence.extend(criticism_contexts) else: print(f"‚ùå No specific criticism contexts found") # Look for policy change mentions with context policy_contexts = [] for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Look for policy/organizational change indicators policy_indicators = [ 'policy change', 'protocol', 'safety measure', 'organizational change', 'injury reporting', 'conduct policy', 'rule change', 'procedure', 'guideline', 'reform', 'revision', 'implemented', 'established', 'new policy', 'safety protocol', 'player safety' ] for indicator in policy_indicators: if indicator in sentence_lower and ('canucks' in sentence_lower or 'vancouver' in sentence_lower or 'nhl' in sentence_lower): policy_contexts.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'indicator': indicator, 'source': title }) break if policy_contexts: print(f"üìã FOUND {len(policy_contexts)} POLICY CHANGE CONTEXTS:") for j, context in enumerate(policy_contexts[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f" {j}. {context['sentence'][:200]}...") print(f" Indicator: {context['indicator']}") policy_evidence.extend(policy_contexts) else: print(f"‚ùå No specific policy change contexts found") # Look for specific critic statements critics = ['marc crawford', 'brian burke', 'gary bettman', 'colin campbell', 'don cherry', 'ron maclean', 'bob mckenzie', 'pat quinn'] critic_mentions = [] for critic in critics: if critic in content_lower: # Find sentences mentioning this critic for sentence in sentences: if critic in sentence.lower(): critic_mentions.append({ 'critic': critic.title(), 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'source': title }) break if critic_mentions: print(f"üë• FOUND {len(critic_mentions)} CRITIC MENTIONS:") for mention in critic_mentions: print(f" ‚Ä¢ {mention['critic']}: {mention['sentence'][:150]}...") critic_statements.extend(critic_mentions) # Look for Vancouver Canucks organizational responses - FIX THE SCOPE ISSUE canucks_responses = [] for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Define sentence_lower here properly response_keywords = ['response', 'responded', 'statement', 'announced', 'implemented', 'changed', 'revised'] if ('canucks' in sentence_lower or 'vancouver' in sentence_lower): for keyword in response_keywords: if keyword in sentence_lower: canucks_responses.append({ 'sentence': sentence.strip(), 'source': title }) break if canucks_responses: print(f"üèí FOUND {len(canucks_responses)} CANUCKS ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:") for response in canucks_responses[:2]: # Show top 2 print(f" ‚Ä¢ {response['sentence'][:150]}...") organizational_responses.extend(canucks_responses) print("=" * 60) # Create comprehensive analysis summary print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print("=" * 50) print(f"Total criticism evidence found: {len(criticism_evidence)}") print(f"Total policy change evidence: {len(policy_evidence)}") print(f"Total critic statements: {len(critic_statements)}") print(f"Total organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)}") # Display key findings if criticism_evidence: print(f"\nüí¨ KEY CRITICISM EVIDENCE:") print("-" * 30) for i, evidence in enumerate(criticism_evidence[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {evidence['source']}") print(f" Indicator: {evidence['indicator']}") print(f" Context: {evidence['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if policy_evidence: print(f"\nüìã KEY POLICY CHANGE EVIDENCE:") print("-" * 32) for i, evidence in enumerate(policy_evidence[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {evidence['source']}") print(f" Indicator: {evidence['indicator']}") print(f" Context: {evidence['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if critic_statements: print(f"\nüë• IDENTIFIED CRITICS AND THEIR STATEMENTS:") print("-" * 45) unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) print(f"Critics identified: {', '.join(unique_critics)}") print() for critic in unique_critics: critic_stmts = [stmt for stmt in critic_statements if stmt['critic'] == critic] print(f"üéØ {critic}:") for j, statement in enumerate(critic_stmts[:2], 1): print(f" {j}. Source: {statement['source']}") print(f" Statement: {statement['sentence'][:200]}...") print() if organizational_responses: print(f"\nüèí VANCOUVER CANUCKS ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:") print("-" * 48) for i, response in enumerate(organizational_responses[:5], 1): print(f"{i}. Source: {response['source']}") print(f" Response: {response['sentence'][:200]}...") print() # Search for specific complaint patterns in the content print(f"\nüîç SEARCHING FOR SPECIFIC COMPLAINT PATTERNS:") print("-" * 50) all_content = ' '.join([source.get('full_text', '') for source in data['scraped_data']]) all_content_lower = all_content.lower() # Look for specific complaint-related phrases complaint_patterns = [ 'public criticized', 'media criticized', 'fans criticized', 'players criticized', 'coaches criticized', 'officials criticized', 'league criticized', 'nhl criticized', 'handling of the incident', 'response to the incident', 'incident was criticized', 'controversy surrounding', 'backlash against', 'outcry over', 'condemned the', 'spoke out against', 'disapproval of', 'criticism of bertuzzi', 'criticism of canucks' ] found_complaints = [] for pattern in complaint_patterns: if pattern in all_content_lower: found_complaints.append(pattern) print(f"‚úÖ Found complaint pattern: '{pattern}'") if not found_complaints: print("‚ùå No specific complaint patterns found in combined content") # Look for policy change indicators print(f"\nüìã SEARCHING FOR POLICY CHANGE INDICATORS:") print("-" * 45) policy_change_patterns = [ 'canucks changed', 'vancouver implemented', 'new safety', 'revised policy', 'organizational change', 'protocol change', 'injury protocol', 'player safety measure', 'conduct policy', 'disciplinary action', 'team policy', 'safety guideline' ] found_policy_changes = [] for pattern in policy_change_patterns: if pattern in all_content_lower: found_policy_changes.append(pattern) print(f"‚úÖ Found policy change pattern: '{pattern}'") if not found_policy_changes: print("‚ùå No specific policy change patterns found in combined content") # Create detailed findings report findings_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_detailed_findings.json' detailed_findings = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'incident_details': { 'date': 'March 8, 2004', 'location': 'GM Place, Vancouver', 'teams': 'Vancouver Canucks vs Colorado Avalanche', 'key_players': 'Todd Bertuzzi (Vancouver) and Steve Moore (Colorado)' }, 'criticism_evidence': criticism_evidence, 'policy_evidence': policy_evidence, 'critic_statements': critic_statements, 'organizational_responses': organizational_responses, 'complaint_patterns_found': found_complaints, 'policy_change_patterns_found': found_policy_changes, 'analysis_summary': { 'total_sources_analyzed': len(data['scraped_data']), 'criticism_instances': len(criticism_evidence), 'policy_instances': len(policy_evidence), 'identified_critics': len(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])), 'organizational_responses': len(organizational_responses), 'complaint_patterns': len(found_complaints), 'policy_patterns': len(found_policy_changes) } } with open(findings_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(detailed_findings, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) # Create summary report for planner summary_file = 'workspace/todd_bertuzzi_incident_final_summary.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("TODD BERTUZZI INCIDENT - COMPLAINTS AND CRITICISM ANALYSIS\n") f.write("=" * 60 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis completed: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Sources analyzed: {len(data['scraped_data'])} websites\n\n") f.write("INCIDENT OVERVIEW:\n") f.write("-" * 18 + "\n") f.write("Date: March 8, 2004\n") f.write("Incident: Todd Bertuzzi (Vancouver Canucks) attacked Steve Moore (Colorado Avalanche)\n") f.write("Location: GM Place, Vancouver\n") f.write("Result: Steve Moore suffered career-ending neck injuries\n\n") f.write("IDENTIFIED CRITICS:\n") f.write("-" * 19 + "\n") if critic_statements: unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) f.write(f"Critics mentioned in sources: {', '.join(unique_critics)}\n\n") for critic in unique_critics: critic_stmts = [stmt for stmt in critic_statements if stmt['critic'] == critic] f.write(f"{critic}:\n") for stmt in critic_stmts[:2]: f.write(f" - {stmt['sentence'][:150]}...\n") f.write(f" (Source: {stmt['source']})\n") f.write("\n") else: f.write("No specific critic statements identified in detail.\n\n") f.write("CRITICISM AND COMPLAINTS FOUND:\n") f.write("-" * 35 + "\n") f.write(f"Criticism evidence instances: {len(criticism_evidence)}\n") f.write(f"Complaint patterns found: {len(found_complaints)}\n") if criticism_evidence: f.write("Key criticism evidence:\n") for i, evidence in enumerate(criticism_evidence[:3], 1): f.write(f"{i}. {evidence['sentence'][:150]}...\n") f.write(f" (Indicator: {evidence['indicator']}, Source: {evidence['source']})\n") if found_complaints: f.write(f"Complaint patterns: {', '.join(found_complaints)}\n") f.write("\n") f.write("POLICY CHANGES AND ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSES:\n") f.write("-" * 45 + "\n") f.write(f"Policy change instances: {len(policy_evidence)}\n") f.write(f"Organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)}\n") f.write(f"Policy change patterns: {len(found_policy_changes)}\n") if policy_evidence or organizational_responses: f.write("Evidence found:\n") for evidence in (policy_evidence + organizational_responses)[:3]: f.write(f" - {evidence['sentence'][:150]}...\n") if found_policy_changes: f.write(f"Policy patterns: {', '.join(found_policy_changes)}\n") else: f.write("Limited evidence of specific Vancouver Canucks policy changes found.\n") f.write("\n") f.write("ANALYSIS CONCLUSION:\n") f.write("-" * 20 + "\n") f.write("Based on the scraped sources, the analysis identified:\n") f.write(f"‚Ä¢ {len(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements]))} key figures mentioned in relation to the incident\n") f.write(f"‚Ä¢ {len(criticism_evidence)} instances of criticism language\n") f.write(f"‚Ä¢ {len(organizational_responses)} organizational response mentions\n") f.write(f"‚Ä¢ {len(found_complaints)} complaint-related patterns\n") f.write("\nLimitations: Analysis based on publicly available sources may not\n") f.write("capture all contemporary criticism or internal policy changes.\n") print(f"\nüìÑ Analysis files created:") print(f"‚Ä¢ Detailed findings: {findings_file}") print(f"‚Ä¢ Summary report: {summary_file}") print(f"\nüèÅ FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS:") print("=" * 40) print(f"üìä Analysis Statistics:") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Sources analyzed: {len(data['scraped_data'])}") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Critics identified: {len(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements]))}") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Criticism evidence: {len(criticism_evidence)} instances") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Policy change evidence: {len(policy_evidence)} instances") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Organizational responses: {len(organizational_responses)} found") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Complaint patterns: {len(found_complaints)} identified") print(f" ‚Ä¢ Policy change patterns: {len(found_policy_changes)} identified") if len(critic_statements) > 0: unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Identified key figures - {', '.join(unique_critics)}") if len(criticism_evidence) > 0 or len(found_complaints) > 0: print(f"‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found evidence of criticism and complaints") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED: Minimal criticism evidence in available sources") if len(policy_evidence) > 0 or len(organizational_responses) > 0 or len(found_policy_changes) > 0: print(f"‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found evidence of organizational responses") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED: Minimal policy change evidence in available sources") print(f"\nüìù Key Findings Summary:") if critic_statements: unique_critics = list(set([stmt['critic'] for stmt in critic_statements])) print(f" ‚Ä¢ Key figures mentioned: {', '.join(unique_critics)}") if found_complaints: print(f" ‚Ä¢ Complaint patterns found: {len(found_complaints)}") if found_policy_changes: print(f" ‚Ä¢ Policy change patterns: {len(found_policy_changes)}") else: print(f"Error: Scraped data file {scrape_file} not found.") print("Available files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: print(" - No workspace directory found")
Execution Output
